#define strEQ(s1, s2)   (strcmp(s1,s2) == 0)
 
#define strNE(s1, s2)   (strcmp(s1,s2) != 0)
 
#define strEQn(s1, s2, n)   (strncmp(s1,s2,n) == 0)
 
#define strNEn(s1, s2, n)   (strncmp(s1,s2,n) != 0)

#define strcNE(s1, s2)   (strcasecmp(s1,s2) != 0)
 
#define strcEQn(s1, s2, n)   (strncasecmp(s1,s2,n) == 0)
 
#define strcNEn(s1, s2, n)   (strncasecmp(s1,s2,n) != 0)
 
#define strIsEmpty(s)   (s == NULL || s[0] == NUL)

  SSL_CVERIFY_OPTIONAL_NO_CA = 3
}
 
enum  ssl_crlcheck_t { SSL_CRLCHECK_NONE = (0), SSL_CRLCHECK_LEAF = (1 << 0), SSL_CRLCHECK_CHAIN = (1 << 1), SSL_CRLCHECK_NO_CRL_FOR_CERT_OK = (1 << 2) }

The following features all depend on TLS extension support. Within this block, check again for features (not version numbers).

#define IDCONST
#define MODSSL_SSL_CIPHER_CONST

...shifting sands of OpenSSL... Note: when adding support for new OpenSSL features, avoid explicit version number checks whenever possible, and use "feature-based" detection instead (check for definitions of constants or functions)

#define MODSSL_USE_OPENSSL_PRE_1_1_API   (OPENSSL_VERSION_NUMBER < 0x10100000L)

Define the SSL options

#define SSL_OPT_OPTRENEGOTIATE   (1<<6)
#define SSL_OPT_RELSET   (1<<0)
#define SSL_OPT_STDENVVARS   (1<<1)
#define SSL_OPT_STRICTREQUIRE   (1<<5)
#define SSL_PCM_EXISTS   1

Define the Path Checking modes

#define SSL_PCM_ISDIR   4
#define SSL_PCM_ISNONZERO   8
#define SSL_PCM_ISREG   2
#define SSL_PROTOCOL_ALL   (SSL_PROTOCOL_BASIC)
#define SSL_PROTOCOL_BASIC   (SSL_PROTOCOL_SSLV3|SSL_PROTOCOL_TLSV1)
#define SSL_PROTOCOL_DEFAULT   (SSL_PROTOCOL_ALL & ~SSL_PROTOCOL_SSLV3)
#define SSL_PROTOCOL_NONE   (0)

Define the SSL Protocol options

#define SSL_PROTOCOL_SSLV3   (1<<1)
#define SSL_PROTOCOL_TLSV1   (1<<2)
#define SSL_SESSION_CACHE_TIMEOUT   300

Defaults for the configuration

#define SSL_STAPLING_CACHE_MUTEX_TYPE   "ssl-stapling"
#define SSL_STAPLING_REFRESH_MUTEX_TYPE   "ssl-stapling-refresh"
#define ssl_verify_error_is_optional (   errnum)
Value:
((errnum == X509_V_ERR_DEPTH_ZERO_SELF_SIGNED_CERT) \
|| (errnum == X509_V_ERR_SELF_SIGNED_CERT_IN_CHAIN) \
|| (errnum == X509_V_ERR_UNABLE_TO_GET_ISSUER_CERT_LOCALLY) \
|| (errnum == X509_V_ERR_CERT_UNTRUSTED) \
|| (errnum == X509_V_ERR_UNABLE_TO_VERIFY_LEAF_SIGNATURE))
errnum
apr_dbd_t int errnum
Definition: apr_dbd.h:353
#define SSL_VERIFY_PEER_STRICT   (SSL_VERIFY_PEER|SSL_VERIFY_FAIL_IF_NO_PEER_CERT)
#define SSLLOG_MARK   __FILE__,__LINE__
#define strcEQ (   s1,
  s2 
)    (strcasecmp(s1,s2) == 0)
#define strcEQn (   s1,
  s2,
  n 
)    (strncasecmp(s1,s2,n) == 0)
#define strcNE (   s1,
  s2 
)    (strcasecmp(s1,s2) != 0)
#define strcNEn (   s1,
  s2,
  n 
)    (strncasecmp(s1,s2,n) != 0)
#define strEQ (   s1,
  s2 
)    (strcmp(s1,s2) == 0)

Provide useful shorthands

#define strEQn (   s1,
  s2,
  n 
)    (strncmp(s1,s2,n) == 0)
#define strIsEmpty (   s)    (s == NULL || s[0] == NUL)
#define strNE (   s1,
  s2 
)    (strcmp(s1,s2) != 0)
#define strNEn (   s1,
  s2,
  n 
)    (strncmp(s1,s2,n) != 0)
#define TRUE   !FALSE
#define UCHAR   unsigned char

Provide reasonable defines for some types

#define UNSET   (-1)
#define X509_STORE_CTX_get0_current_issuer (   x)    (x->current_issuer)
#define X509_STORE_CTX_get0_store (   x)    (x->ctx)

Function Documentation

APLOG_USE_MODULE ( ssl  )
OCSP_RESPONSE* modssl_dispatch_ocsp_request ( const apr_uri_t *  uri,
apr_interval_time_t  timeout,
OCSP_REQUEST *  request,
conn_rec *  c,
apr_pool_t *  p 
)
309 {
310  OCSP_RESPONSE *response = NULL;
311  apr_socket_t *sd;
312  BIO *bio;
313  const apr_uri_t *proxy_uri;
314 
315  proxy_uri = (mySrvConfigFromConn(c))->server->proxy_uri;
316  bio = serialize_request(request, uri, proxy_uri);
317  if (bio == NULL) {
318  ap_log_cerror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_ERR, 0, c, APLOGNO(01989)
319  "could not serialize OCSP request");
320  ssl_log_ssl_error(SSLLOG_MARK, APLOG_ERR, mySrvFromConn(c));
321  return NULL;
322  }
323 
324  sd = send_request(bio, uri, timeout, c, p, proxy_uri);
325  if (sd == NULL) {
326  /* Errors already logged. */
327  BIO_free(bio);
328  return NULL;
329  }
330 
331  /* Clear the BIO contents, ready for the response. */
332  (void)BIO_reset(bio);
333 
334  response = read_response(sd, bio, c, p);
335 
336  apr_socket_close(sd);
337  BIO_free(bio);
338 
339  return response;
340 }

void modssl_var_extract_dns ( apr_table_t *  t,
SSL *  ssl,
apr_pool_t *  p 
)
957 {
958  apr_hash_t *nids;
959  unsigned n;
960  X509 *xs;
961 
962  /* Build up a hash table of (int *)NID->(char *)short-name for all
963  * the tags which are to be extracted: */
964  nids = apr_hash_make(p);
965  for (n = 0; ssl_var_lookup_ssl_cert_dn_rec[n].name; n++) {
966  if (ssl_var_lookup_ssl_cert_dn_rec[n].extract) {
967  apr_hash_set(nids, &ssl_var_lookup_ssl_cert_dn_rec[n].nid,
968  sizeof(ssl_var_lookup_ssl_cert_dn_rec[0].nid),
969  ssl_var_lookup_ssl_cert_dn_rec[n].name);
970  }
971  }
972 
973  /* Extract the server cert DNS -- note that the refcount does NOT
974  * increase: */
975  xs = SSL_get_certificate(ssl);
976  if (xs) {
977  extract_dn(t, nids, "SSL_SERVER_S_DN_", X509_get_subject_name(xs), p);
978  extract_dn(t, nids, "SSL_SERVER_I_DN_", X509_get_issuer_name(xs), p);
979  }
980 
981  /* Extract the client cert DNs -- note that the refcount DOES
982  * increase: */
983  xs = SSL_get_peer_certificate(ssl);
984  if (xs) {
985  extract_dn(t, nids, "SSL_CLIENT_S_DN_", X509_get_subject_name(xs), p);
986  extract_dn(t, nids, "SSL_CLIENT_I_DN_", X509_get_issuer_name(xs), p);
987  X509_free(xs);
988  }
989 }
nid
int nid
Definition: ssl_engine_vars.c:569
ssl
conn_rec SSL * ssl
Definition: mod_ssl_openssl.h:60
name
char * name

void modssl_var_extract_san_entries ( apr_table_t *  t,
SSL *  ssl,
apr_pool_t *  p 
)
1003 {
1004  X509 *xs;
1005  apr_array_header_t *entries;
1006 
1007  /* subjectAltName entries of the server certificate */
1008  xs = SSL_get_certificate(ssl);
1009  if (xs) {
1010  if (modssl_X509_getSAN(p, xs, GEN_EMAIL, NULL, -1, &entries)) {
1011  extract_san_array(t, "SSL_SERVER_SAN_Email", entries, p);
1012  }
1013  if (modssl_X509_getSAN(p, xs, GEN_DNS, NULL, -1, &entries)) {
1014  extract_san_array(t, "SSL_SERVER_SAN_DNS", entries, p);
1015  }
1016  if (modssl_X509_getSAN(p, xs, GEN_OTHERNAME, "id-on-dnsSRV", -1,
1017  &entries)) {
1018  extract_san_array(t, "SSL_SERVER_SAN_OTHER_dnsSRV", entries, p);
1019  }
1020  /* no need to free xs (refcount does not increase) */
1021  }
1022 
1023  /* subjectAltName entries of the client certificate */
1024  xs = SSL_get_peer_certificate(ssl);
1025  if (xs) {
1026  if (modssl_X509_getSAN(p, xs, GEN_EMAIL, NULL, -1, &entries)) {
1027  extract_san_array(t, "SSL_CLIENT_SAN_Email", entries, p);
1028  }
1029  if (modssl_X509_getSAN(p, xs, GEN_DNS, NULL, -1, &entries)) {
1030  extract_san_array(t, "SSL_CLIENT_SAN_DNS", entries, p);
1031  }
1032  if (modssl_X509_getSAN(p, xs, GEN_OTHERNAME, "msUPN", -1, &entries)) {
1033  extract_san_array(t, "SSL_CLIENT_SAN_OTHER_msUPN", entries, p);
1034  }
1035  X509_free(xs);
1036  }
1037 }

Here is the caller graph for this function:

int modssl_verify_ocsp ( X509_STORE_CTX *  ctx,
SSLSrvConfigRec *  sc,
server_rec *  s,
conn_rec *  c,
apr_pool_t *  pool 
)
257 {
258  X509 *cert = X509_STORE_CTX_get_current_cert(ctx);
259  apr_pool_t *vpool;
260  int rv;
261 
262  if (!cert) {
263  /* starting with OpenSSL 1.0, X509_STORE_CTX_get_current_cert()
264  * may yield NULL. Return early, but leave the ctx error as is. */
265  ap_log_cerror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_TRACE2, 0, c,
266  "No cert available to check with OCSP");
267  return 1;
268  }
269  else if (X509_check_issued(cert,cert) == X509_V_OK) {
270  /* don't do OCSP checking for valid self-issued certs */
271  ap_log_cerror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_TRACE2, 0, c,
272  "Skipping OCSP check for valid self-issued cert");
273  X509_STORE_CTX_set_error(ctx, X509_V_OK);
274  return 1;
275  }
276 
277  /* Create a temporary pool to constrain memory use (the passed-in
278  * pool may be e.g. a connection pool). */
279  apr_pool_create(&vpool, pool);
280 
281  rv = verify_ocsp_status(cert, ctx, c, sc, s, vpool);
282 
283  apr_pool_destroy(vpool);
284 
285  /* Propagate the verification status back to the passed-in
286  * context. */
287  switch (rv) {
288  case V_OCSP_CERTSTATUS_GOOD:
289  X509_STORE_CTX_set_error(ctx, X509_V_OK);
290  break;
291 
292  case V_OCSP_CERTSTATUS_REVOKED:
293  X509_STORE_CTX_set_error(ctx, X509_V_ERR_CERT_REVOKED);
294  break;
295 
296  case V_OCSP_CERTSTATUS_UNKNOWN:
297  /* correct error code for application errors? */
298  X509_STORE_CTX_set_error(ctx, X509_V_ERR_APPLICATION_VERIFICATION);
299  break;
300  }
301 
302  return rv == V_OCSP_CERTSTATUS_GOOD;
303 }
apr_pool_t
Definition: apr_pools.c:577
APLOG_MARK
#define APLOG_MARK
Definition: http_log.h:283
apr_pool_create
#define apr_pool_create(newpool, parent)
Definition: apr_pools.h:322
ap_log_cerror
#define ap_log_cerror
Definition: http_log.h:498
ctx
void * ctx
Definition: util_filter.h:409

#define APLOG_TRACE2
Definition: http_log.h:52

Here is the caller graph for this function:

unsigned char* ssl_asn1_table_set ( apr_hash_t *  table,
const char *  key,
long int  length 
)
194 {
195  apr_ssize_t klen = strlen(key);
196  ssl_asn1_t *asn1 = apr_hash_get(table, key, klen);
197 
198  /*
199  * if a value for this key already exists,
200  * reuse as much of the already malloc-ed data
201  * as possible.
202  */
203  if (asn1) {
204  if (asn1->nData != length) {
205  free(asn1->cpData); /* XXX: realloc? */
206  asn1->cpData = NULL;
207  }
208  }
209  else {
210  asn1 = ap_malloc(sizeof(*asn1));
211  asn1->source_mtime = 0; /* used as a note for encrypted private keys */
212  asn1->cpData = NULL;
213  }
214 
215  asn1->nData = length;
216  if (!asn1->cpData) {
217  asn1->cpData = ap_malloc(length);
218  }
219 
220  apr_hash_set(table, key, klen, asn1);
221 
222  return asn1->cpData; /* caller will assign a value to this */
223 }
klen
apr_ssize_t * klen

length

void ssl_asn1_table_unset ( apr_hash_t *  table,
const char *  key 
)
233 {
234  apr_ssize_t klen = strlen(key);
235  ssl_asn1_t *asn1 = apr_hash_get(table, key, klen);
236 
237  if (!asn1) {
238  return;
239  }
240 
241  if (asn1->cpData) {
242  free(asn1->cpData);
243  }
244  free(asn1);
245 
246  apr_hash_set(table, key, klen, NULL);
247 }

Here is the call graph for this function:

void ssl_callback_DelSessionCacheEntry ( SSL_CTX *  ,
SSL_SESSION *   
)
1962 {
1963  server_rec *s;
1964  SSLSrvConfigRec *sc;
1965  IDCONST unsigned char *id;
1966  unsigned int idlen;
1967 
1968  /*
1969  * Get Apache context back through OpenSSL context
1970  */
1971  if (!(s = (server_rec *)SSL_CTX_get_app_data(ctx))) {
1972  return; /* on server shutdown Apache is already gone */
1973  }
1974 
1975  sc = mySrvConfig(s);
1976 
1977  /*
1978  * Remove the SSL_SESSION from the inter-process cache
1979  */
1980 #ifdef OPENSSL_NO_SSL_INTERN
1981  id = (unsigned char *)SSL_SESSION_get_id(session, &idlen);
1982 #else
1983  id = session->session_id;
1984  idlen = session->session_id_length;
1985 #endif
1986 
1987  /* TODO: Do we need a temp pool here, or are we always shutting down? */
1988  ssl_scache_remove(s, id, idlen, sc->mc->pPool);
1989 
1990  ssl_session_log(s, "REM", id, idlen,
1991  "OK", "dead", 0);
1992 
1993  return;
1994 }

apr_pool_t * pPool

SSL_SESSION* ssl_callback_GetSessionCacheEntry ( SSL *  ,
IDCONST unsigned char *  ,
int  ,
int *   
)
1928 {
1929  /* Get Apache context back through OpenSSL context */
1930  conn_rec *conn = (conn_rec *)SSL_get_app_data(ssl);
1931  server_rec *s = mySrvFromConn(conn);
1932  SSL_SESSION *session;
1933 
1934  /*
1935  * Try to retrieve the SSL_SESSION from the inter-process cache
1936  */
1937  session = ssl_scache_retrieve(s, id, idlen, conn->pool);
1938 
1939  ssl_session_log(s, "GET", id, idlen,
1940  session ? "FOUND" : "MISSED",
1941  session ? "reuse" : "renewal", 0);
1942 
1943  /*
1944  * Return NULL or the retrieved SSL_SESSION. But indicate (by
1945  * setting do_copy to 0) that the reference count on the
1946  * SSL_SESSION should not be incremented by the SSL library,
1947  * because we will no longer hold a reference to it ourself.
1948  */
1949  *do_copy = 0;
1950 
1951  return session;
1952 }

void ssl_callback_Info ( const SSL *  ,
int  ,
int   
)
2069 {
2070  conn_rec *c;
2071  server_rec *s;
2072  SSLConnRec *scr;
2073 
2074  /* Retrieve the conn_rec and the associated SSLConnRec. */
2075  if ((c = (conn_rec *)SSL_get_app_data((SSL *)ssl)) == NULL) {
2076  return;
2077  }
2078 
2079  if ((scr = myConnConfig(c)) == NULL) {
2080  return;
2081  }
2082 
2083  /* If the reneg state is to reject renegotiations, check the SSL
2084  * state machine and move to ABORT if a Client Hello is being
2085  * read. */
2086  if (!scr->is_proxy &&
2087  (where & SSL_CB_HANDSHAKE_START) &&
2088  scr->reneg_state == RENEG_REJECT) {
2089  scr->reneg_state = RENEG_ABORT;
2090  ap_log_cerror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_ERR, 0, c, APLOGNO(02042)
2091  "rejecting client initiated renegotiation");
2092  }
2093  /* If the first handshake is complete, change state to reject any
2094  * subsequent client-initiated renegotiation. */
2095  else if ((where & SSL_CB_HANDSHAKE_DONE) && scr->reneg_state == RENEG_INIT) {
2096  scr->reneg_state = RENEG_REJECT;
2097  }
2098 
2099  s = mySrvFromConn(c);
2100  if (s && APLOGdebug(s)) {
2101  log_tracing_state(ssl, c, s, where, rc);
2102  }
2103 }

int ssl_callback_NewSessionCacheEntry ( SSL *  ,
SSL_SESSION *   
)
1875 {
1876  /* Get Apache context back through OpenSSL context */
1877  conn_rec *conn = (conn_rec *)SSL_get_app_data(ssl);
1878  server_rec *s = mySrvFromConn(conn);
1879  SSLSrvConfigRec *sc = mySrvConfig(s);
1880  long timeout = sc->session_cache_timeout;
1881  BOOL rc;
1882  IDCONST unsigned char *id;
1883  unsigned int idlen;
1884 
1885  /*
1886  * Set the timeout also for the internal OpenSSL cache, because this way
1887  * our inter-process cache is consulted only when it's really necessary.
1888  */
1889  SSL_set_timeout(session, timeout);
1890 
1891  /*
1892  * Store the SSL_SESSION in the inter-process cache with the
1893  * same expire time, so it expires automatically there, too.
1894  */
1895 #ifdef OPENSSL_NO_SSL_INTERN
1896  id = (unsigned char *)SSL_SESSION_get_id(session, &idlen);
1897 #else
1898  id = session->session_id;
1899  idlen = session->session_id_length;
1900 #endif
1901 
1902  rc = ssl_scache_store(s, id, idlen,
1903  apr_time_from_sec(SSL_SESSION_get_time(session)
1904  + timeout),
1905  session, conn->pool);
1906 
1907  ssl_session_log(s, "SET", id, idlen,
1908  rc == TRUE ? "OK" : "BAD",
1909  "caching", timeout);
1910 
1911  /*
1912  * return 0 which means to OpenSSL that the session is still
1913  * valid and was not freed by us with SSL_SESSION_free().
1914  */
1915  return 0;
1916 }
IDCONST
#define IDCONST

int ssl_callback_proxy_cert ( SSL *  ssl,
X509 **  x509,
EVP_PKEY **  pkey 
)
1751 {
1752  conn_rec *c = (conn_rec *)SSL_get_app_data(ssl);
1753  server_rec *s = mySrvFromConn(c);
1754  SSLSrvConfigRec *sc = mySrvConfig(s);
1755  X509_NAME *ca_name, *issuer, *ca_issuer;
1756  X509_INFO *info;
1757  X509 *ca_cert;
1758  STACK_OF(X509_NAME) *ca_list;
1759  STACK_OF(X509_INFO) *certs = sc->proxy->pkp->certs;
1760  STACK_OF(X509) *ca_certs;
1761  STACK_OF(X509) **ca_cert_chains;
1762  int i, j, k;
1763 
1764  ap_log_error(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_DEBUG, 0, s, APLOGNO(02267)
1765  SSLPROXY_CERT_CB_LOG_FMT "entered",
1766  sc->vhost_id);
1767 
1768  if (!certs || (sk_X509_INFO_num(certs) <= 0)) {
1769  ap_log_error(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_WARNING, 0, s, APLOGNO(02268)
1770  SSLPROXY_CERT_CB_LOG_FMT
1771  "downstream server wanted client certificate "
1772  "but none are configured", sc->vhost_id);
1773  return FALSE;
1774  }
1775 
1776  ca_list = SSL_get_client_CA_list(ssl);
1777 
1778  if (!ca_list || (sk_X509_NAME_num(ca_list) <= 0)) {
1779  /*
1780  * downstream server didn't send us a list of acceptable CA certs,
1781  * so we send the first client cert in the list.
1782  */
1783  info = sk_X509_INFO_value(certs, 0);
1784 
1785  modssl_proxy_info_log(c, info, APLOGNO(02278) "no acceptable CA list");
1786 
1787  modssl_set_cert_info(info, x509, pkey);
1788 
1789  return TRUE;
1790  }
1791 
1792  ca_cert_chains = sc->proxy->pkp->ca_certs;
1793  for (i = 0; i < sk_X509_NAME_num(ca_list); i++) {
1794  ca_name = sk_X509_NAME_value(ca_list, i);
1795 
1796  for (j = 0; j < sk_X509_INFO_num(certs); j++) {
1797  info = sk_X509_INFO_value(certs, j);
1798  issuer = X509_get_issuer_name(info->x509);
1799 
1800  /* Search certs (by issuer name) one by one*/
1801  if (X509_NAME_cmp(issuer, ca_name) == 0) {
1802  modssl_proxy_info_log(c, info, APLOGNO(02279)
1803  "found acceptable cert");
1804 
1805  modssl_set_cert_info(info, x509, pkey);
1806 
1807  return TRUE;
1808  }
1809 
1810  if (ca_cert_chains) {
1811  /*
1812  * Failed to find direct issuer - search intermediates
1813  * (by issuer name), if provided.
1814  */
1815  ca_certs = ca_cert_chains[j];
1816  for (k = 0; k < sk_X509_num(ca_certs); k++) {
1817  ca_cert = sk_X509_value(ca_certs, k);
1818  ca_issuer = X509_get_issuer_name(ca_cert);
1819 
1820  if(X509_NAME_cmp(ca_issuer, ca_name) == 0 ) {
1821  modssl_proxy_info_log(c, info, APLOGNO(02280)
1822  "found acceptable cert by intermediate CA");
1823 
1824  modssl_set_cert_info(info, x509, pkey);
1825 
1826  return TRUE;
1827  }
1828  } /* end loop through chained certs */
1829  }
1830  } /* end loop through available certs */
1831  }
1832 
1833  ap_log_error(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_DEBUG, 0, s, APLOGNO(02269)
1834  SSLPROXY_CERT_CB_LOG_FMT
1835  "no client certificate found!?", sc->vhost_id);
1836 
1837  return FALSE;
1838 }
APLOG_MARK
#define APLOG_MARK
Definition: http_log.h:283
FALSE
#define FALSE
Definition: ssl_private.h:71

conn_rec * c
Definition: http_core.h:849

Definition: http_log.h:50

Definition: http_log.h:370

int ssl_callback_SSLVerify ( int  ,
X509_STORE_CTX *   
)
1553 {
1554  /* Get Apache context back through OpenSSL context */
1555  SSL *ssl = X509_STORE_CTX_get_ex_data(ctx,
1556  SSL_get_ex_data_X509_STORE_CTX_idx());
1557  conn_rec *conn = (conn_rec *)SSL_get_app_data(ssl);
1558  request_rec *r = (request_rec *)modssl_get_app_data2(ssl);
1559  server_rec *s = r ? r->server : mySrvFromConn(conn);
1560 
1561  SSLSrvConfigRec *sc = mySrvConfig(s);
1562  SSLDirConfigRec *dc = r ? myDirConfig(r) : NULL;
1563  SSLConnRec *sslconn = myConnConfig(conn);
1564  modssl_ctx_t *mctx = myCtxConfig(sslconn, sc);
1565  int crl_check_mode = mctx->crl_check_mask & ~SSL_CRLCHECK_FLAGS;
1566 
1567  /* Get verify ingredients */
1568  int errnum = X509_STORE_CTX_get_error(ctx);
1569  int errdepth = X509_STORE_CTX_get_error_depth(ctx);
1570  int depth, verify;
1571 
1572 
1573  /*
1574  * Log verification information
1575  */
1576  ssl_log_cxerror(SSLLOG_MARK, APLOG_DEBUG, 0, conn,
1577  X509_STORE_CTX_get_current_cert(ctx), APLOGNO(02275)
1578  "Certificate Verification, depth %d, "
1579  "CRL checking mode: %s (%x)", errdepth,
1580  crl_check_mode == SSL_CRLCHECK_CHAIN ? "chain" :
1581  crl_check_mode == SSL_CRLCHECK_LEAF ? "leaf" : "none",
1582  mctx->crl_check_mask);
1583 
1584  /*
1585  * Check for optionally acceptable non-verifiable issuer situation
1586  */
1587  if (dc && (dc->nVerifyClient != SSL_CVERIFY_UNSET)) {
1588  verify = dc->nVerifyClient;
1589  }
1590  else {
1591  verify = mctx->auth.verify_mode;
1592  }
1593 
1594  if (verify == SSL_CVERIFY_NONE) {
1595  /*
1596  * SSLProxyVerify is either not configured or set to "none".
1597  * (this callback doesn't happen in the server context if SSLVerify
1598  * is not configured or set to "none")
1599  */
1600  return TRUE;
1601  }
1602 
1603  if (ssl_verify_error_is_optional(errnum) &&
1604  (verify == SSL_CVERIFY_OPTIONAL_NO_CA))
1605  {
1606  ap_log_cerror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_DEBUG, 0, conn, APLOGNO(02037)
1607  "Certificate Verification: Verifiable Issuer is "
1608  "configured as optional, therefore we're accepting "
1609  "the certificate");
1610 
1611  sslconn->verify_info = "GENEROUS";
1612  ok = TRUE;
1613  }
1614 
1615  /*
1616  * Expired certificates vs. "expired" CRLs: by default, OpenSSL
1617  * turns X509_V_ERR_CRL_HAS_EXPIRED into a "certificate_expired(45)"
1618  * SSL alert, but that's not really the message we should convey to the
1619  * peer (at the very least, it's confusing, and in many cases, it's also
1620  * inaccurate, as the certificate itself may very well not have expired
1621  * yet). We set the X509_STORE_CTX error to something which OpenSSL's
1622  * s3_both.c:ssl_verify_alarm_type() maps to SSL_AD_CERTIFICATE_UNKNOWN,
1623  * i.e. the peer will receive a "certificate_unknown(46)" alert.
1624  * We do not touch errnum, though, so that later on we will still log
1625  * the "real" error, as returned by OpenSSL.
1626  */
1627  if (!ok && errnum == X509_V_ERR_CRL_HAS_EXPIRED) {
1628  X509_STORE_CTX_set_error(ctx, -1);
1629  }
1630 
1631  if (!ok && errnum == X509_V_ERR_UNABLE_TO_GET_CRL
1632  && (mctx->crl_check_mask & SSL_CRLCHECK_NO_CRL_FOR_CERT_OK)) {
1633  ap_log_cerror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_TRACE3, 0, conn,
1634  "Certificate Verification: Temporary error (%d): %s: "
1635  "optional therefore we're accepting the certificate",
1636  errnum, X509_verify_cert_error_string(errnum));
1637  X509_STORE_CTX_set_error(ctx, X509_V_OK);
1638  errnum = X509_V_OK;
1639  ok = TRUE;
1640  }
1641 
1642 #ifndef OPENSSL_NO_OCSP
1643  /*
1644  * Perform OCSP-based revocation checks
1645  */
1646  if (ok && sc->server->ocsp_enabled) {
1647  /* If there was an optional verification error, it's not
1648  * possible to perform OCSP validation since the issuer may be
1649  * missing/untrusted. Fail in that case. */
1650  if (ssl_verify_error_is_optional(errnum)) {
1651  X509_STORE_CTX_set_error(ctx, X509_V_ERR_APPLICATION_VERIFICATION);
1652  errnum = X509_V_ERR_APPLICATION_VERIFICATION;
1653  ap_log_cerror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_ERR, 0, conn, APLOGNO(02038)
1654  "cannot perform OCSP validation for cert "
1655  "if issuer has not been verified "
1656  "(optional_no_ca configured)");
1657  ok = FALSE;
1658  } else {
1659  ok = modssl_verify_ocsp(ctx, sc, s, conn, conn->pool);
1660  if (!ok) {
1661  errnum = X509_STORE_CTX_get_error(ctx);
1662  }
1663  }
1664  }
1665 #endif
1666 
1667  /*
1668  * If we already know it's not ok, log the real reason
1669  */
1670  if (!ok) {
1671  if (APLOGcinfo(conn)) {
1672  ssl_log_cxerror(SSLLOG_MARK, APLOG_INFO, 0, conn,
1673  X509_STORE_CTX_get_current_cert(ctx), APLOGNO(02276)
1674  "Certificate Verification: Error (%d): %s",
1675  errnum, X509_verify_cert_error_string(errnum));
1676  } else {
1677  ap_log_cerror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_ERR, 0, conn, APLOGNO(02039)
1678  "Certificate Verification: Error (%d): %s",
1679  errnum, X509_verify_cert_error_string(errnum));
1680  }
1681 
1682  if (sslconn->client_cert) {
1683  X509_free(sslconn->client_cert);
1684  sslconn->client_cert = NULL;
1685  }
1686  sslconn->client_dn = NULL;
1687  sslconn->verify_error = X509_verify_cert_error_string(errnum);
1688  }
1689 
1690  /*
1691  * Finally check the depth of the certificate verification
1692  */
1693  if (dc && (dc->nVerifyDepth != UNSET)) {
1694  depth = dc->nVerifyDepth;
1695  }
1696  else {
1697  depth = mctx->auth.verify_depth;
1698  }
1699 
1700  if (errdepth > depth) {
1701  ap_log_cerror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_ERR, 0, conn, APLOGNO(02040)
1702  "Certificate Verification: Certificate Chain too long "
1703  "(chain has %d certificates, but maximum allowed are "
1704  "only %d)",
1705  errdepth, depth);
1706 
1707  errnum = X509_V_ERR_CERT_CHAIN_TOO_LONG;
1708  sslconn->verify_error = X509_verify_cert_error_string(errnum);
1709 
1710  ok = FALSE;
1711  }
1712 
1713  /*
1714  * And finally signal OpenSSL the (perhaps changed) state
1715  */
1716  return ok;
1717 }
SSL_CVERIFY_OPTIONAL_NO_CA
Definition: ssl_private.h:391
SSL_CRLCHECK_NO_CRL_FOR_CERT_OK
Definition: ssl_private.h:413
SSL_CRLCHECK_CHAIN
Definition: ssl_private.h:410
APLOG_INFO
#define APLOG_INFO
Definition: http_log.h:49
APLOG_MARK
#define APLOG_MARK
Definition: http_log.h:283

int ssl_callback_SSLVerify_CRL ( int  ,
X509_STORE_CTX *  ,
conn_rec *   
)
DH* ssl_callback_TmpDH ( SSL *  ,
int  ,
int   
)

OpenSSL callbacks

1506 {
1507  conn_rec *c = (conn_rec *)SSL_get_app_data(ssl);
1508  EVP_PKEY *pkey;
1509  int type;
1510 
1511 #ifdef SSL_CERT_SET_SERVER
1512  /*
1513  * When multiple certs/keys are configured for the SSL_CTX: make sure
1514  * that we get the private key which is indeed used for the current
1515  * SSL connection (available in OpenSSL 1.0.2 or later only)
1516  */
1517  SSL_set_current_cert(ssl, SSL_CERT_SET_SERVER);
1518 #endif
1519  pkey = SSL_get_privatekey(ssl);
1520 #if OPENSSL_VERSION_NUMBER < 0x10100000L
1521  type = pkey ? EVP_PKEY_type(pkey->type) : EVP_PKEY_NONE;
1522 #else
1523  type = pkey ? EVP_PKEY_base_id(pkey) : EVP_PKEY_NONE;
1524 #endif
1525 
1526  /*
1527  * OpenSSL will call us with either keylen == 512 or keylen == 1024
1528  * (see the definition of SSL_EXPORT_PKEYLENGTH in ssl_locl.h).
1529  * Adjust the DH parameter length according to the size of the
1530  * RSA/DSA private key used for the current connection, and always
1531  * use at least 1024-bit parameters.
1532  * Note: This may cause interoperability issues with implementations
1533  * which limit their DH support to 1024 bit - e.g. Java 7 and earlier.
1534  * In this case, SSLCertificateFile can be used to specify fixed
1535  * 1024-bit DH parameters (with the effect that OpenSSL skips this
1536  * callback).
1537  */
1538  if ((type == EVP_PKEY_RSA) || (type == EVP_PKEY_DSA)) {
1539  keylen = EVP_PKEY_bits(pkey);
1540  }
1541 
1542  ap_log_cerror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_TRACE2, 0, c,
1543  "handing out built-in DH parameters for %d-bit authenticated connection", keylen);
1544 
1545  return modssl_get_dh_params(keylen);
1546 }

const char* ssl_cmd_SSLCipherSuite ( cmd_parms *  ,
void *  ,
const char *   
)
733 {
734  SSLSrvConfigRec *sc = mySrvConfig(cmd->server);
735  SSLDirConfigRec *dc = (SSLDirConfigRec *)dcfg;
736 
737  /* always disable null and export ciphers */
738  arg = apr_pstrcat(cmd->pool, arg, ":!aNULL:!eNULL:!EXP", NULL);
739 
740  if (cmd->path) {
741  dc->szCipherSuite = arg;
742  }
743  else {
744  sc->server->auth.cipher_suite = arg;
745  }
746 
747  return NULL;
748 }

int  flag 
)

780  SSLSrvConfigRec *sc = mySrvConfig(cmd->server);
781 #ifndef SSL_OP_NO_COMPRESSION
782  const char *err = ap_check_cmd_context(cmd, GLOBAL_ONLY);
783  if (err)
784  return "This version of openssl does not support configuring "
785  "compression within <VirtualHost> sections.";
786 #endif
787  sc->compression = flag ? TRUE : FALSE;
788  return NULL;

790  return "Setting Compression mode unsupported; not implemented by the SSL library";
791 #endif

const char* ssl_cmd_SSLEngine ( cmd_parms *  ,
void *  ,
const char *   
)
688 {
689  SSLSrvConfigRec *sc = mySrvConfig(cmd->server);
690 
691  if (!strcasecmp(arg, "On")) {
692  sc->enabled = SSL_ENABLED_TRUE;
693  return NULL;
694  }
695  else if (!strcasecmp(arg, "Off")) {
696  sc->enabled = SSL_ENABLED_FALSE;
697  return NULL;
698  }
699  else if (!strcasecmp(arg, "Optional")) {
700  sc->enabled = SSL_ENABLED_OPTIONAL;
701  return NULL;
702  }
703 
704  return "Argument must be On, Off, or Optional";
705 }

const char* ssl_cmd_SSLFIPS ( cmd_parms *  cmd,
void *  dcfg,
int  flag 
)
708 {
709 #ifdef HAVE_FIPS
710  SSLSrvConfigRec *sc = mySrvConfig(cmd->server);
711 #endif
712  const char *err;
713 
714  if ((err = ap_check_cmd_context(cmd, GLOBAL_ONLY))) {
715  return err;
716  }
717 
718 #ifdef HAVE_FIPS
719  if ((sc->fips != UNSET) && (sc->fips != (BOOL)(flag ? TRUE : FALSE)))
720  return "Conflicting SSLFIPS options, cannot be both On and Off";
721  sc->fips = flag ? TRUE : FALSE;
722 #else
723  if (flag)
724  return "SSLFIPS invalid, rebuild httpd and openssl compiled for FIPS";
725 #endif
726 
727  return NULL;
728 }

1716 {

1718  sc->server->proxy_uri = apr_palloc(cmd->pool, sizeof(apr_uri_t));
1719  if (apr_uri_parse(cmd->pool, arg, sc->server->proxy_uri) != APR_SUCCESS) {
1720  return apr_psprintf(cmd->pool,

Definition: ssl_private.h:701
const char* ssl_cmd_SSLOptions ( cmd_parms *  ,
void *  ,
const char *   
)
1249 {
1250  SSLDirConfigRec *dc = (SSLDirConfigRec *)dcfg;
1251  ssl_opt_t opt;
1252  int first = TRUE;
1253  char action, *w;
1254 
1255  while (*arg) {
1256  w = ap_getword_conf(cmd->temp_pool, &arg);
1257  action = NUL;
1258 
1259  if ((*w == '+') || (*w == '-')) {
1260  action = *(w++);
1261  }
1262  else if (first) {
1263  dc->nOptions = SSL_OPT_NONE;
1264  first = FALSE;
1265  }
1266 
1267  if (strcEQ(w, "StdEnvVars")) {
1268  opt = SSL_OPT_STDENVVARS;
1269  }
1270  else if (strcEQ(w, "ExportCertData")) {
1271  opt = SSL_OPT_EXPORTCERTDATA;
1272  }
1273  else if (strcEQ(w, "FakeBasicAuth")) {
1274  opt = SSL_OPT_FAKEBASICAUTH;
1275  }
1276  else if (strcEQ(w, "StrictRequire")) {
1277  opt = SSL_OPT_STRICTREQUIRE;
1278  }
1279  else if (strcEQ(w, "OptRenegotiate")) {
1280  opt = SSL_OPT_OPTRENEGOTIATE;
1281  }
1282  else if (strcEQ(w, "LegacyDNStringFormat")) {
1283  opt = SSL_OPT_LEGACYDNFORMAT;
1284  }
1285  else {
1286  return apr_pstrcat(cmd->pool,
1287  "SSLOptions: Illegal option '", w, "'",
1288  NULL);
1289  }
1290 
1291  if (action == '-') {
1292  dc->nOptionsAdd &= ~opt;
1293  dc->nOptionsDel |= opt;
1294  dc->nOptions &= ~opt;
1295  }
1296  else if (action == '+') {
1297  dc->nOptionsAdd |= opt;
1298  dc->nOptionsDel &= ~opt;
1299  dc->nOptions |= opt;
1300  }
1301  else {
1302  dc->nOptions = opt;
1303  dc->nOptionsAdd = opt;
1304  dc->nOptionsDel = SSL_OPT_NONE;
1305  }
1306  }
1307 
1308  return NULL;
1309 }
SSL_OPT_OPTRENEGOTIATE
#define SSL_OPT_OPTRENEGOTIATE
Definition: ssl_private.h:351

const char* ssl_cmd_SSLPassPhraseDialog ( cmd_parms *  ,
void *  ,
const char *   
)
512 {
513  SSLSrvConfigRec *sc = mySrvConfig(cmd->server);
514  const char *err;
515  int arglen = strlen(arg);
516 
517  if ((err = ap_check_cmd_context(cmd, GLOBAL_ONLY))) {
518  return err;
519  }
520 
521  if (strcEQ(arg, "builtin")) {
522  sc->server->pphrase_dialog_type = SSL_PPTYPE_BUILTIN;
523  sc->server->pphrase_dialog_path = NULL;
524  }
525  else if ((arglen > 5) && strEQn(arg, "exec:", 5)) {
526  sc->server->pphrase_dialog_type = SSL_PPTYPE_FILTER;
527  sc->server->pphrase_dialog_path =
528  ap_server_root_relative(cmd->pool, arg+5);
529  if (!sc->server->pphrase_dialog_path) {
530  return apr_pstrcat(cmd->pool,
531  "Invalid SSLPassPhraseDialog exec: path ",
532  arg+5, NULL);
533  }
534  if (!ssl_util_path_check(SSL_PCM_EXISTS,
535  sc->server->pphrase_dialog_path,
536  cmd->pool))
537  {
538  return apr_pstrcat(cmd->pool,
539  "SSLPassPhraseDialog: file '",
540  sc->server->pphrase_dialog_path,
541  "' does not exist", NULL);
542  }
543 
544  }
545  else if ((arglen > 1) && (arg[0] == '|')) {
546  sc->server->pphrase_dialog_type = SSL_PPTYPE_PIPE;
547  sc->server->pphrase_dialog_path = arg + 1;
548  }
549  else {
550  return "SSLPassPhraseDialog: Invalid argument";
551  }
552 
553  return NULL;
554 }
SSL_PPTYPE_BUILTIN
Definition: ssl_private.h:421
SSL_PPTYPE_PIPE
Definition: ssl_private.h:423

const char* ssl_cmd_SSLRandomSeed ( cmd_parms *  ,
void *  ,
const char *  ,
const char *  ,
const char *   
)
599 {
600  SSLModConfigRec *mc = myModConfig(cmd->server);
601  const char *err;
602  ssl_randseed_t *seed;
603  int arg2len = strlen(arg2);
604 
605  if ((err = ap_check_cmd_context(cmd, GLOBAL_ONLY))) {
606  return err;
607  }
608 
609  if (ssl_config_global_isfixed(mc)) {
610  return NULL;
611  }
612 
613  seed = apr_array_push(mc->aRandSeed);
614 
615  if (strcEQ(arg1, "startup")) {
616  seed->nCtx = SSL_RSCTX_STARTUP;
617  }
618  else if (strcEQ(arg1, "connect")) {
619  seed->nCtx = SSL_RSCTX_CONNECT;
620  }
621  else {
622  return apr_pstrcat(cmd->pool, "SSLRandomSeed: "
623  "invalid context: `", arg1, "'",
624  NULL);
625  }
626 
627  if ((arg2len > 5) && strEQn(arg2, "file:", 5)) {
628  seed->nSrc = SSL_RSSRC_FILE;
629  seed->cpPath = ap_server_root_relative(mc->pPool, arg2+5);
630  }
631  else if ((arg2len > 5) && strEQn(arg2, "exec:", 5)) {
632  seed->nSrc = SSL_RSSRC_EXEC;
633  seed->cpPath = ap_server_root_relative(mc->pPool, arg2+5);
634  }
635  else if ((arg2len > 4) && strEQn(arg2, "egd:", 4)) {
636 #ifdef HAVE_RAND_EGD
637  seed->nSrc = SSL_RSSRC_EGD;
638  seed->cpPath = ap_server_root_relative(mc->pPool, arg2+4);
639 #else
640  return apr_pstrcat(cmd->pool, "Invalid SSLRandomSeed entropy source `",
641  arg2, "': This version of " MODSSL_LIBRARY_NAME
642  " does not support the Entropy Gathering Daemon "
643  "(EGD).", NULL);
644 #endif
645  }
646  else if (strcEQ(arg2, "builtin")) {
647  seed->nSrc = SSL_RSSRC_BUILTIN;
648  seed->cpPath = NULL;
649  }
650  else {
651  seed->nSrc = SSL_RSSRC_FILE;
652  seed->cpPath = ap_server_root_relative(mc->pPool, arg2);
653  }
654 
655  if (seed->nSrc != SSL_RSSRC_BUILTIN) {
656  if (!seed->cpPath) {
657  return apr_pstrcat(cmd->pool,
658  "Invalid SSLRandomSeed path ",
659  arg2, NULL);
660  }
661  if (!ssl_util_path_check(SSL_PCM_EXISTS, seed->cpPath, cmd->pool)) {
662  return apr_pstrcat(cmd->pool,
663  "SSLRandomSeed: source path '",
664  seed->cpPath, "' does not exist", NULL);
665  }
666  }
667 
668  if (!arg3) {
669  seed->nBytes = 0; /* read whole file */
670  }
671  else {
672  if (seed->nSrc == SSL_RSSRC_BUILTIN) {
673  return "SSLRandomSeed: byte specification not "
674  "allowed for builtin seed source";
675  }
676 
677  seed->nBytes = atoi(arg3);
678 
679  if (seed->nBytes < 0) {
680  return "SSLRandomSeed: invalid number of bytes specified";
681  }
682  }
683 
684  return NULL;
685 }

apr_pool_t * pPool
Definition: ssl_private.h:559

Definition: ssl_private.h:461

1329  info->flags = AP_EXPR_FLAG_SSL_EXPR_COMPAT;

const char* ssl_cmd_SSLSessionCache ( cmd_parms *  ,
void *  ,
const char *   
)
1158 {
1159  SSLModConfigRec *mc = myModConfig(cmd->server);
1160  const char *err, *sep, *name;
1161  long enabled_flags;
1162 
1163  if ((err = ap_check_cmd_context(cmd, GLOBAL_ONLY))) {
1164  return err;
1165  }
1166 
1167  /* The OpenSSL session cache mode must have both the flags
1168  * SSL_SESS_CACHE_SERVER and SSL_SESS_CACHE_NO_INTERNAL set if a
1169  * session cache is configured; NO_INTERNAL prevents the
1170  * OpenSSL-internal session cache being used in addition to the
1171  * "external" (mod_ssl-provided) cache, which otherwise causes
1172  * additional memory consumption. */
1173  enabled_flags = SSL_SESS_CACHE_SERVER | SSL_SESS_CACHE_NO_INTERNAL;
1174 
1175  if (strcEQ(arg, "none")) {
1176  /* Nothing to do; session cache will be off. */
1177  }
1178  else if (strcEQ(arg, "nonenotnull")) {
1179  /* ### Having a separate mode for this seems logically
1180  * unnecessary; the stated purpose of sending non-empty
1181  * session IDs would be better fixed in OpenSSL or simply
1182  * doing it by default if "none" is used. */
1183  mc->sesscache_mode = enabled_flags;
1184  }
1185  else {
1186  /* Argument is of form 'name:args' or just 'name'. */
1187  sep = ap_strchr_c(arg, ':');
1188  if (sep) {
1189  name = apr_pstrmemdup(cmd->pool, arg, sep - arg);
1190  sep++;
1191  }
1192  else {
1193  name = arg;
1194  }
1195 
1196  /* Find the provider of given name. */
1197  mc->sesscache = ap_lookup_provider(AP_SOCACHE_PROVIDER_GROUP,
1198  name,
1199  AP_SOCACHE_PROVIDER_VERSION);
1200  if (mc->sesscache) {
1201  /* Cache found; create it, passing anything beyond the colon. */
1202  mc->sesscache_mode = enabled_flags;
1203  err = mc->sesscache->create(&mc->sesscache_context, sep,
1204  cmd->temp_pool, cmd->pool);
1205  }
1206  else {
1207  apr_array_header_t *name_list;
1208  const char *all_names;
1209 
1210  /* Build a comma-separated list of all registered provider
1211  * names: */
1212  name_list = ap_list_provider_names(cmd->pool,
1213  AP_SOCACHE_PROVIDER_GROUP,
1214  AP_SOCACHE_PROVIDER_VERSION);
1215  all_names = apr_array_pstrcat(cmd->pool, name_list, ',');
1216 
1217  err = apr_psprintf(cmd->pool, "'%s' session cache not supported "
1218  "(known names: %s). Maybe you need to load the "
1219  "appropriate socache module (mod_socache_%s?).",
1220  name, all_names, name);
1221  }
1222  }
1223 
1224  if (err) {
1225  return apr_psprintf(cmd->pool, "SSLSessionCache: %s", err);
1226  }
1227 
1228  return NULL;
1229 }
name
apr_pool_t const char * name
Definition: http_config.h:800
apr_array_header_t
Definition: apr_tables.h:62

const char* ssl_cmd_SSLVerifyClient ( cmd_parms *  ,
void *  ,
const char *   
)
1099 {
1100  SSLDirConfigRec *dc = (SSLDirConfigRec *)dcfg;
1101  SSLSrvConfigRec *sc = mySrvConfig(cmd->server);
1102  ssl_verify_t mode;
1103  const char *err;
1104 
1105  if ((err = ssl_cmd_verify_parse(cmd, arg, &mode))) {
1106  return err;
1107  }
1108 
1109  if (cmd->path) {
1110  dc->nVerifyClient = mode;
1111  }
1112  else {
1113  sc->server->auth.verify_mode = mode;
1114  }
1115 
1116  return NULL;
1117 }

SSLModConfigRec* ssl_config_global_create ( server_rec *  )

configuration handling

42 {
43  apr_pool_t *pool = s->process->pool;
44  SSLModConfigRec *mc;
45  void *vmc;
46 
47  apr_pool_userdata_get(&vmc, SSL_MOD_CONFIG_KEY, pool);
48  if (vmc) {
49  return vmc; /* reused for lifetime of the server */
50  }
51 
52  /*
53  * allocate an own subpool which survives server restarts
54  */
55  mc = (SSLModConfigRec *)apr_palloc(pool, sizeof(*mc));
56  mc->pPool = pool;
57  mc->bFixed = FALSE;
58 
59  /*
60  * initialize per-module configuration
61  */
62  mc->sesscache_mode = SSL_SESS_CACHE_OFF;
63  mc->sesscache = NULL;
64  mc->pMutex = NULL;
65  mc->aRandSeed = apr_array_make(pool, 4,
66  sizeof(ssl_randseed_t));
67  mc->tVHostKeys = apr_hash_make(pool);
68  mc->tPrivateKey = apr_hash_make(pool);
69 #if defined(HAVE_OPENSSL_ENGINE_H) && defined(HAVE_ENGINE_INIT)
70  mc->szCryptoDevice = NULL;
71 #endif
72 #ifdef HAVE_OCSP_STAPLING
73  mc->stapling_cache = NULL;
74  mc->stapling_cache_mutex = NULL;
75  mc->stapling_refresh_mutex = NULL;
76 #endif
77 
78  apr_pool_userdata_set(mc, SSL_MOD_CONFIG_KEY,
79  apr_pool_cleanup_null,
80  pool);
81 
82  return mc;
83 }

void* ssl_config_perdir_merge ( apr_pool_t *  ,
void *  ,
void *   
)
470 {
471  SSLDirConfigRec *base = (SSLDirConfigRec *)basev;
472  SSLDirConfigRec *add = (SSLDirConfigRec *)addv;
473  SSLDirConfigRec *mrg = (SSLDirConfigRec *)apr_palloc(p, sizeof(*mrg));
474 
475  cfgMerge(bSSLRequired, FALSE);
476  cfgMergeArray(aRequirement);
477 
478  if (add->nOptions & SSL_OPT_RELSET) {
479  mrg->nOptionsAdd =
480  (base->nOptionsAdd & ~(add->nOptionsDel)) | add->nOptionsAdd;
481  mrg->nOptionsDel =
482  (base->nOptionsDel & ~(add->nOptionsAdd)) | add->nOptionsDel;
483  mrg->nOptions =
484  (base->nOptions & ~(mrg->nOptionsDel)) | mrg->nOptionsAdd;
485  }
486  else {
487  mrg->nOptions = add->nOptions;
488  mrg->nOptionsAdd = add->nOptionsAdd;
489  mrg->nOptionsDel = add->nOptionsDel;
490  }
491 
492  cfgMergeString(szCipherSuite);
493  cfgMerge(nVerifyClient, SSL_CVERIFY_UNSET);
494  cfgMergeInt(nVerifyDepth);
495 
496  cfgMergeString(szCACertificatePath);
497  cfgMergeString(szCACertificateFile);
498  cfgMergeString(szUserName);
499 
500  cfgMergeInt(nRenegBufferSize);
501 
502  return mrg;
503 }

DH* ssl_dh_GetParamFromFile ( const char *  )

Diffie-Hellman Parameter Support

460 {
461  DH *dh = NULL;
462  BIO *bio;
463 
464  if ((bio = BIO_new_file(file, "r")) == NULL)
465  return NULL;
466  dh = PEM_read_bio_DHparams(bio, NULL, NULL, NULL);
467  BIO_free(bio);
468  return (dh);

apr_status_t ssl_die ( server_rec *  )
67 {
68  if (s != NULL && s->is_virtual && s->error_fname != NULL)
69  ap_log_error(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_EMERG, 0, NULL, APLOGNO(02311)
70  "Fatal error initialising mod_ssl, exiting. "
71  "See %s for more information",
72  ap_server_root_relative(s->process->pool,
73  s->error_fname));
74  else
75  ap_log_error(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_EMERG, 0, NULL, APLOGNO(02312)
76  "Fatal error initialising mod_ssl, exiting.");
77 
78  return APR_EGENERAL;
79 }

Here is the caller graph for this function:

apr_array_header_t* ssl_ext_list ( apr_pool_t *  p,
conn_rec *  c,
int  peer,
const char *  extension 
)
1062 {
1063  SSLConnRec *sslconn = ssl_get_effective_config(c);
1064  SSL *ssl = NULL;
1065  apr_array_header_t *array = NULL;
1066  X509 *xs = NULL;
1067  ASN1_OBJECT *oid = NULL;
1068  int count = 0, j;
1069 
1070  if (!sslconn || !sslconn->ssl || !extension) {
1071  return NULL;
1072  }
1073  ssl = sslconn->ssl;
1074 
1075  /* We accept the "extension" string to be converted as
1076  * a long name (nsComment), short name (DN) or
1077  * numeric OID (1.2.3.4).
1078  */
1079  oid = OBJ_txt2obj(extension, 0);
1080  if (!oid) {
1081  ap_log_cerror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_DEBUG, 0, c, APLOGNO(01970)
1082  "could not parse OID '%s'", extension);
1083  ERR_clear_error();
1084  return NULL;
1085  }
1086 
1087  xs = peer ? SSL_get_peer_certificate(ssl) : SSL_get_certificate(ssl);
1088  if (xs == NULL) {
1089  return NULL;
1090  }
1091 
1092  count = X509_get_ext_count(xs);
1093  /* Create an array large enough to accommodate every extension. This is
1094  * likely overkill, but safe.
1095  */
1096  array = apr_array_make(p, count, sizeof(char *));
1097  for (j = 0; j < count; j++) {
1098  X509_EXTENSION *ext = X509_get_ext(xs, j);
1099 
1100  if (OBJ_cmp(X509_EXTENSION_get_object(ext), oid) == 0) {
1101  BIO *bio = BIO_new(BIO_s_mem());
1102 
1103  /* We want to obtain a string representation of the extensions
1104  * value and add it to the array we're building.
1105  * X509V3_EXT_print() doesn't know about all the possible
1106  * data types, but the value is stored as an ASN1_OCTET_STRING
1107  * allowing us a fallback in case of X509V3_EXT_print
1108  * not knowing how to handle the data.
1109  */
1110  if (X509V3_EXT_print(bio, ext, 0, 0) == 1 ||
1111  dump_extn_value(bio, X509_EXTENSION_get_data(ext)) == 1) {
1112  BUF_MEM *buf;
1113  char **ptr = apr_array_push(array);
1114  BIO_get_mem_ptr(bio, &buf);
1115  *ptr = apr_pstrmemdup(p, buf->data, buf->length);
1116  } else {
1117  ap_log_cerror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_DEBUG, 0, c, APLOGNO(01971)
1118  "Found an extension '%s', but failed to "
1119  "create a string from it", extension);
1120  }
1121  BIO_vfree(bio);
1122  }
1123  }
1124 
1125  if (array->nelts == 0)
1126  array = NULL;
1127 
1128  if (peer) {
1129  /* only SSL_get_peer_certificate raises the refcount */
1130  X509_free(xs);
1131  }
1132 
1133  ASN1_OBJECT_free(oid);
1134  ERR_clear_error();
1135  return array;
1136 }
APLOG_MARK
#define APLOG_MARK
Definition: http_log.h:283
apr_array_header_t
Definition: apr_tables.h:62
APLOG_DEBUG
#define APLOG_DEBUG
Definition: http_log.h:50
SSLConnRec::ssl
SSL * ssl
Definition: ssl_private.h:495
ssl
conn_rec SSL * ssl
Definition: mod_ssl_openssl.h:60
apr_array_header_t::nelts
int nelts
Definition: apr_tables.h:68
SSL
SSL
Definition: mod_ssl_openssl.h:60
ap_log_cerror
#define ap_log_cerror
Definition: http_log.h:498
ptr
struct ap_filter_t apr_array_header_t ** ptr
Definition: httpd.h:2118
count
unsigned int count
Definition: apr_md5.h:152
NULL
this is a typedef for a structure whose contents are not externally defined It is up to the caller to free the that it does not depend on memory the complete pcre data block is not fully because it may contain a copy of the tableptr argu which is an those that are compatible with but some others as well can also be set and unset from within the the contents of the options argument specifies their settings at the start of compilation and execution The and PCRE_NO_START_OPTIMIZE options can be set at the time of matching as well as at compile time If errptr is NULL
Definition: pcre.txt:2065

int const char * buf
Definition: http_protocol.h:974
APLOGNO
#define APLOGNO(n)
Definition: http_log.h:117
SSLConnRec
Definition: ssl_private.h:494

Here is the caller graph for this function:

int ssl_hook_Access ( request_rec *  )
422 {
423  SSLDirConfigRec *dc = myDirConfig(r);
424  SSLSrvConfigRec *sc = mySrvConfig(r->server);
425  SSLConnRec *sslconn = myConnConfig(r->connection);
426  SSL *ssl = sslconn ? sslconn->ssl : NULL;
427  server_rec *handshakeserver = sslconn ? sslconn->server : NULL;
428  SSLSrvConfigRec *hssc = handshakeserver? mySrvConfig(handshakeserver) : NULL;
429  SSL_CTX *ctx = NULL;
430  apr_array_header_t *requires;
431  ssl_require_t *ssl_requires;
432  int ok, i;
433  BOOL renegotiate = FALSE, renegotiate_quick = FALSE;
434  X509 *cert;
435  X509 *peercert;
436  X509_STORE *cert_store = NULL;
437  X509_STORE_CTX *cert_store_ctx;
438  STACK_OF(SSL_CIPHER) *cipher_list_old = NULL, *cipher_list = NULL;
439  const SSL_CIPHER *cipher = NULL;
440  int depth, verify_old, verify, n, is_slave = 0;
441  const char *ncipher_suite;
442 
443  /* On a slave connection, we do not expect to have an SSLConnRec, but
444  * our master connection might have one. */
445  if (!(sslconn && ssl) && r->connection->master) {
446  sslconn = myConnConfig(r->connection->master);
447  ssl = sslconn ? sslconn->ssl : NULL;
448  handshakeserver = sslconn ? sslconn->server : NULL;
449  hssc = handshakeserver? mySrvConfig(handshakeserver) : NULL;
450  is_slave = 1;
451  }
452 
453  if (ssl) {
454  /*
455  * We should have handshaken here (on handshakeserver),
456  * otherwise we are being redirected (ErrorDocument) from
457  * a renegotiation failure below. The access is still
458  * forbidden in the latter case, let ap_die() handle
459  * this recursive (same) error.
460  */
461  if (!SSL_is_init_finished(ssl)) {
462  return HTTP_FORBIDDEN;
463  }
464  ctx = SSL_get_SSL_CTX(ssl);
465  }
466 
467  /*
468  * Support for SSLRequireSSL directive
469  */
470  if (dc->bSSLRequired && !ssl) {
471  if ((sc->enabled == SSL_ENABLED_OPTIONAL) && !is_slave) {
472  /* This vhost was configured for optional SSL, just tell the
473  * client that we need to upgrade.
474  */
475  apr_table_setn(r->err_headers_out, "Upgrade", "TLS/1.0, HTTP/1.1");
476  apr_table_setn(r->err_headers_out, "Connection", "Upgrade");
477 
478  return HTTP_UPGRADE_REQUIRED;
479  }
480 
481  ap_log_rerror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_ERR, 0, r, APLOGNO(02219)
482  "access to %s failed, reason: %s",
483  r->filename, "SSL connection required");
484 
485  /* remember forbidden access for strict require option */
486  apr_table_setn(r->notes, "ssl-access-forbidden", "1");
487 
488  return HTTP_FORBIDDEN;
489  }
490 
491  /*
492  * Check to see whether SSL is in use; if it's not, then no
493  * further access control checks are relevant. (the test for
494  * sc->enabled is probably strictly unnecessary)
495  */
496  if (sc->enabled == SSL_ENABLED_FALSE || !ssl) {
497  return DECLINED;
498  }
499 
500 #ifdef HAVE_SRP
501  /*
502  * Support for per-directory reconfigured SSL connection parameters
503  *
504  * We do not force any renegotiation if the user is already authenticated
505  * via SRP.
506  *
507  */
508  if (SSL_get_srp_username(ssl)) {
509  return DECLINED;
510  }
511 #endif
512 
513  /*
514  * Support for per-directory reconfigured SSL connection parameters.
515  *
516  * This is implemented by forcing an SSL renegotiation with the
517  * reconfigured parameter suite. But Apache's internal API processing
518  * makes our life very hard here, because when internal sub-requests occur
519  * we nevertheless should avoid multiple unnecessary SSL handshakes (they
520  * require extra network I/O and especially time to perform).
521  *
522  * But the optimization for filtering out the unnecessary handshakes isn't
523  * obvious and trivial. Especially because while Apache is in its
524  * sub-request processing the client could force additional handshakes,
525  * too. And these take place perhaps without our notice. So the only
526  * possibility is to explicitly _ask_ OpenSSL whether the renegotiation
527  * has to be performed or not. It has to performed when some parameters
528  * which were previously known (by us) are not those we've now
529  * reconfigured (as known by OpenSSL) or (in optimized way) at least when
530  * the reconfigured parameter suite is stronger (more restrictions) than
531  * the currently active one.
532  */
533 
534  /*
535  * Override of SSLCipherSuite
536  *
537  * We provide two options here:
538  *
539  * o The paranoid and default approach where we force a renegotiation when
540  * the cipher suite changed in _any_ way (which is straight-forward but
541  * often forces renegotiations too often and is perhaps not what the
542  * user actually wanted).
543  *
544  * o The optimized and still secure way where we force a renegotiation
545  * only if the currently active cipher is no longer contained in the
546  * reconfigured/new cipher suite. Any other changes are not important
547  * because it's the servers choice to select a cipher from the ones the
548  * client supports. So as long as the current cipher is still in the new
549  * cipher suite we're happy. Because we can assume we would have
550  * selected it again even when other (better) ciphers exists now in the
551  * new cipher suite. This approach is fine because the user explicitly
552  * has to enable this via ``SSLOptions +OptRenegotiate''. So we do no
553  * implicit optimizations.
554  */
555  ncipher_suite = (dc->szCipherSuite?
556  dc->szCipherSuite : (r->server != handshakeserver)?
557  sc->server->auth.cipher_suite : NULL);
558 
559  if (ncipher_suite && (!sslconn->cipher_suite
560  || strcmp(ncipher_suite, sslconn->cipher_suite))) {
561  /* remember old state */
562 
563  if (dc->nOptions & SSL_OPT_OPTRENEGOTIATE) {
564  cipher = SSL_get_current_cipher(ssl);
565  }
566  else {
567  cipher_list_old = (STACK_OF(SSL_CIPHER) *)SSL_get_ciphers(ssl);
568 
569  if (cipher_list_old) {
570  cipher_list_old = sk_SSL_CIPHER_dup(cipher_list_old);
571  }
572  }
573 
574  /* configure new state */
575  if (is_slave) {
576  /* TODO: this categorically fails changed cipher suite settings
577  * on slave connections. We could do better by
578  * - create a new SSL* from our SSL_CTX and set cipher suite there,
579  * and retrieve ciphers, free afterwards
580  * Modifying the SSL on a slave connection is no good.
581  */
582  apr_table_setn(r->notes, "ssl-renegotiate-forbidden", "cipher-suite");
583  return HTTP_FORBIDDEN;
584  }
585 
586  if (!SSL_set_cipher_list(ssl, ncipher_suite)) {
587  ap_log_rerror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_WARNING, 0, r, APLOGNO(02253)
588  "Unable to reconfigure (per-directory) "
589  "permitted SSL ciphers");
590  ssl_log_ssl_error(SSLLOG_MARK, APLOG_ERR, r->server);
591 
592  if (cipher_list_old) {
593  sk_SSL_CIPHER_free(cipher_list_old);
594  }
595 
596  return HTTP_FORBIDDEN;
597  }
598 
599  /* determine whether a renegotiation has to be forced */
600  cipher_list = (STACK_OF(SSL_CIPHER) *)SSL_get_ciphers(ssl);
601 
602  if (dc->nOptions & SSL_OPT_OPTRENEGOTIATE) {
603  /* optimized way */
604  if ((!cipher && cipher_list) ||
605  (cipher && !cipher_list))
606  {
607  renegotiate = TRUE;
608  }
609  else if (cipher && cipher_list &&
610  (sk_SSL_CIPHER_find(cipher_list, cipher) < 0))
611  {
612  renegotiate = TRUE;
613  }
614  }
615  else {
616  /* paranoid way */
617  if ((!cipher_list_old && cipher_list) ||
618  (cipher_list_old && !cipher_list))
619  {
620  renegotiate = TRUE;
621  }
622  else if (cipher_list_old && cipher_list) {
623  for (n = 0;
624  !renegotiate && (n < sk_SSL_CIPHER_num(cipher_list));
625  n++)
626  {
627  const SSL_CIPHER *value = sk_SSL_CIPHER_value(cipher_list, n);
628 
629  if (sk_SSL_CIPHER_find(cipher_list_old, value) < 0) {
630  renegotiate = TRUE;
631  }
632  }
633 
634  for (n = 0;
635  !renegotiate && (n < sk_SSL_CIPHER_num(cipher_list_old));
636  n++)
637  {
638  const SSL_CIPHER *value = sk_SSL_CIPHER_value(cipher_list_old, n);
639 
640  if (sk_SSL_CIPHER_find(cipher_list, value) < 0) {
641  renegotiate = TRUE;
642  }
643  }
644  }
645  }
646 
647  /* cleanup */
648  if (cipher_list_old) {
649  sk_SSL_CIPHER_free(cipher_list_old);
650  }
651 
652  if (renegotiate) {
653  if (is_slave) {
654  /* The request causes renegotiation on a slave connection.
655  * This is not allowed since we might have concurrent requests
656  * on this connection.
657  */
658  apr_table_setn(r->notes, "ssl-renegotiate-forbidden", "cipher-suite");
659  return HTTP_FORBIDDEN;
660  }
661 
662 #ifdef SSL_OP_CIPHER_SERVER_PREFERENCE
663  if (sc->cipher_server_pref == TRUE) {
664  SSL_set_options(ssl, SSL_OP_CIPHER_SERVER_PREFERENCE);
665  }
666 #endif
667  /* tracing */
668  ap_log_rerror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_DEBUG, 0, r, APLOGNO(02220)
669  "Reconfigured cipher suite will force renegotiation");
670  }
671  }
672 
673  /*
674  * override of SSLVerifyClient
675  *
676  * We force a renegotiation if the reconfigured/new verify type is
677  * stronger than the currently active verify type.
678  *
679  * The order is: none << optional_no_ca << optional << require
680  *
681  * Additionally the following optimization is possible here: When the
682  * currently active verify type is "none" but a client certificate is
683  * already known/present, it's enough to manually force a client
684  * verification but at least skip the I/O-intensive renegotiation
685  * handshake.
686  */
687  if ((dc->nVerifyClient != SSL_CVERIFY_UNSET) ||
688  (sc->server->auth.verify_mode != SSL_CVERIFY_UNSET)) {
689 
690  /* remember old state */
691  verify_old = SSL_get_verify_mode(ssl);
692  /* configure new state */
693  verify = SSL_VERIFY_NONE;
694 
695  if ((dc->nVerifyClient == SSL_CVERIFY_REQUIRE) ||
696  (sc->server->auth.verify_mode == SSL_CVERIFY_REQUIRE)) {
697  verify |= SSL_VERIFY_PEER_STRICT;
698  }
699 
700  if ((dc->nVerifyClient == SSL_CVERIFY_OPTIONAL) ||
701  (dc->nVerifyClient == SSL_CVERIFY_OPTIONAL_NO_CA) ||
702  (sc->server->auth.verify_mode == SSL_CVERIFY_OPTIONAL) ||
703  (sc->server->auth.verify_mode == SSL_CVERIFY_OPTIONAL_NO_CA))
704  {
705  verify |= SSL_VERIFY_PEER;
706  }
707 
708  /* TODO: this seems premature since we do not know if there
709  * are any changes required.
710  */
711  SSL_set_verify(ssl, verify, ssl_callback_SSLVerify);
712  SSL_set_verify_result(ssl, X509_V_OK);
713 
714  /* determine whether we've to force a renegotiation */
715  if (!renegotiate && verify != verify_old) {
716  if (((verify_old == SSL_VERIFY_NONE) &&
717  (verify != SSL_VERIFY_NONE)) ||
718 
719  (!(verify_old & SSL_VERIFY_PEER) &&
720  (verify & SSL_VERIFY_PEER)) ||
721 
722  (!(verify_old & SSL_VERIFY_FAIL_IF_NO_PEER_CERT) &&
723  (verify & SSL_VERIFY_FAIL_IF_NO_PEER_CERT)))
724  {
725  renegotiate = TRUE;
726  if (is_slave) {
727  /* The request causes renegotiation on a slave connection.
728  * This is not allowed since we might have concurrent requests
729  * on this connection.
730  */
731  apr_table_setn(r->notes, "ssl-renegotiate-forbidden", "verify-client");
732  SSL_set_verify(ssl, verify_old, ssl_callback_SSLVerify);
733  return HTTP_FORBIDDEN;
734  }
735  /* optimization */
736 
737  if ((dc->nOptions & SSL_OPT_OPTRENEGOTIATE) &&
738  (verify_old == SSL_VERIFY_NONE) &&
739  ((peercert = SSL_get_peer_certificate(ssl)) != NULL))
740  {
741  renegotiate_quick = TRUE;
742  X509_free(peercert);
743  }
744 
745  ap_log_rerror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_DEBUG, 0, r, APLOGNO(02255)
746  "Changed client verification type will force "
747  "%srenegotiation",
748  renegotiate_quick ? "quick " : "");
749  }
750  else if (verify != SSL_VERIFY_NONE) {
751  /*
752  * override of SSLVerifyDepth
753  *
754  * The depth checks are handled by us manually inside the
755  * verify callback function and not by OpenSSL internally
756  * (and our function is aware of both the per-server and
757  * per-directory contexts). So we cannot ask OpenSSL about
758  * the currently verify depth. Instead we remember it in our
759  * SSLConnRec attached to the SSL* of OpenSSL. We've to force
760  * the renegotiation if the reconfigured/new verify depth is
761  * less than the currently active/remembered verify depth
762  * (because this means more restriction on the certificate
763  * chain).
764  */
765  n = (sslconn->verify_depth != UNSET)
766  ? sslconn->verify_depth
767  : hssc->server->auth.verify_depth;
768  /* determine the new depth */
769  sslconn->verify_depth = (dc->nVerifyDepth != UNSET)
770  ? dc->nVerifyDepth
771  : sc->server->auth.verify_depth;
772  if (sslconn->verify_depth < n) {
773  renegotiate = TRUE;
774  ap_log_rerror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_DEBUG, 0, r, APLOGNO(02254)
775  "Reduced client verification depth will "
776  "force renegotiation");
777  }
778  }
779  }
780  /* If we're handling a request for a vhost other than the default one,
781  * then we need to make sure that client authentication is properly
782  * enforced. For clients supplying an SNI extension, the peer
783  * certificate verification has happened in the handshake already
784  * (and r->server == handshakeserver). For non-SNI requests,
785  * an additional check is needed here. If client authentication
786  * is configured as mandatory, then we can only proceed if the
787  * CA list doesn't have to be changed (OpenSSL doesn't provide
788  * an option to change the list for an existing session).
789  */
790  if ((r->server != handshakeserver)
791  && renegotiate
792  && ((verify & SSL_VERIFY_PEER) ||
793  (verify & SSL_VERIFY_FAIL_IF_NO_PEER_CERT))) {
794 #define MODSSL_CFG_CA_NE(f, sc1, sc2) \
795  (sc1->server->auth.f && \
796  (!sc2->server->auth.f || \
797  strNE(sc1->server->auth.f, sc2->server->auth.f)))
798 
799  if (MODSSL_CFG_CA_NE(ca_cert_file, sc, hssc) ||
800  MODSSL_CFG_CA_NE(ca_cert_path, sc, hssc)) {
801  if (verify & SSL_VERIFY_FAIL_IF_NO_PEER_CERT) {
802  ap_log_rerror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_INFO, 0, r, APLOGNO(02256)
803  "Non-default virtual host with SSLVerify set to "
804  "'require' and VirtualHost-specific CA certificate "
805  "list is only available to clients with TLS server "
806  "name indication (SNI) support");
807  SSL_set_verify(ssl, verify_old, NULL);
808  return HTTP_FORBIDDEN;
809  } else
810  /* let it pass, possibly with an "incorrect" peer cert,
811  * so make sure the SSL_CLIENT_VERIFY environment variable
812  * will indicate partial success only, later on.
813  */
814  sslconn->verify_info = "GENEROUS";
815  }
816  }
817  }
818 
819  /* If a renegotiation is now required for this location, and the
820  * request includes a message body (and the client has not
821  * requested a "100 Continue" response), then the client will be
822  * streaming the request body over the wire already. In that
823  * case, it is not possible to stop and perform a new SSL
824  * handshake immediately; once the SSL library moves to the
825  * "accept" state, it will reject the SSL packets which the client
826  * is sending for the request body.
827  *
828  * To allow authentication to complete in this auth hook, the
829  * solution used here is to fill a (bounded) buffer with the
830  * request body, and then to reinject that request body later.
831  */
832  if (renegotiate && !renegotiate_quick
833  && (apr_table_get(r->headers_in, "transfer-encoding")
834  || (apr_table_get(r->headers_in, "content-length")
835  && strcmp(apr_table_get(r->headers_in, "content-length"), "0")))
836  && !r->expecting_100) {
837  int rv;
838  apr_size_t rsize;
839 
840  rsize = dc->nRenegBufferSize == UNSET ? DEFAULT_RENEG_BUFFER_SIZE :
841  dc->nRenegBufferSize;
842  if (rsize > 0) {
843  /* Fill the I/O buffer with the request body if possible. */
844  rv = ssl_io_buffer_fill(r, rsize);
845  }
846  else {
847  /* If the reneg buffer size is set to zero, just fail. */
848  rv = HTTP_REQUEST_ENTITY_TOO_LARGE;
849  }
850 
851  if (rv) {
852  ap_log_rerror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_ERR, 0, r, APLOGNO(02257)
853  "could not buffer message body to allow "
854  "SSL renegotiation to proceed");
855  return rv;
856  }
857  }
858 
859  /*
860  * now do the renegotiation if anything was actually reconfigured
861  */
862  if (renegotiate) {
863  /*
864  * Now we force the SSL renegotiation by sending the Hello Request
865  * message to the client. Here we have to do a workaround: Actually
866  * OpenSSL returns immediately after sending the Hello Request (the
867  * intent AFAIK is because the SSL/TLS protocol says it's not a must
868  * that the client replies to a Hello Request). But because we insist
869  * on a reply (anything else is an error for us) we have to go to the
870  * ACCEPT state manually. Using SSL_set_accept_state() doesn't work
871  * here because it resets too much of the connection. So we set the
872  * state explicitly and continue the handshake manually.
873  */
874  ap_log_rerror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_INFO, 0, r, APLOGNO(02221)
875  "Requesting connection re-negotiation");
876 
877  if (renegotiate_quick) {
878  STACK_OF(X509) *cert_stack;
879 
880  /* perform just a manual re-verification of the peer */
881  ap_log_rerror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_DEBUG, 0, r, APLOGNO(02258)
882  "Performing quick renegotiation: "
883  "just re-verifying the peer");
884 
885  cert_stack = (STACK_OF(X509) *)SSL_get_peer_cert_chain(ssl);
886 
887  cert = SSL_get_peer_certificate(ssl);
888 
889  if (!cert_stack || (sk_X509_num(cert_stack) == 0)) {
890  if (!cert) {
891  ap_log_rerror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_ERR, 0, r, APLOGNO(02222)
892  "Cannot find peer certificate chain");
893 
894  return HTTP_FORBIDDEN;
895  }
896 
897  /* client cert is in the session cache, but there is
898  * no chain, since ssl3_get_client_certificate()
899  * sk_X509_shift-ed the peer cert out of the chain.
900  * we put it back here for the purpose of quick_renegotiation.
901  */
902  cert_stack = sk_X509_new_null();
903  sk_X509_push(cert_stack, cert);
904  }
905 
906  if (!(cert_store ||
907  (cert_store = SSL_CTX_get_cert_store(ctx))))
908  {
909  ap_log_rerror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_ERR, 0, r, APLOGNO(02223)
910  "Cannot find certificate storage");
911 
912  return HTTP_FORBIDDEN;
913  }
914 
915  if (!cert) {
916  cert = sk_X509_value(cert_stack, 0);
917  }
918 
919  cert_store_ctx = X509_STORE_CTX_new();
920  X509_STORE_CTX_init(cert_store_ctx, cert_store, cert, cert_stack);
921  depth = SSL_get_verify_depth(ssl);
922 
923  if (depth >= 0) {
924  X509_STORE_CTX_set_depth(cert_store_ctx, depth);
925  }
926 
927  X509_STORE_CTX_set_ex_data(cert_store_ctx,
928  SSL_get_ex_data_X509_STORE_CTX_idx(),
929  (char *)ssl);
930 
931  if (!X509_verify_cert(cert_store_ctx)) {
932  ap_log_rerror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_ERR, 0, r, APLOGNO(02224)
933  "Re-negotiation verification step failed");
934  ssl_log_ssl_error(SSLLOG_MARK, APLOG_ERR, r->server);
935  }
936 
937  SSL_set_verify_result(ssl, X509_STORE_CTX_get_error(cert_store_ctx));
938  X509_STORE_CTX_cleanup(cert_store_ctx);
939  X509_STORE_CTX_free(cert_store_ctx);
940 
941  if (cert_stack != SSL_get_peer_cert_chain(ssl)) {
942  /* we created this ourselves, so free it */
943  sk_X509_pop_free(cert_stack, X509_free);
944  }
945  }
946  else {
947  char peekbuf[1];
948  const char *reneg_support;
949  request_rec *id = r->main ? r->main : r;
950 
951  /* Additional mitigation for CVE-2009-3555: At this point,
952  * before renegotiating, an (entire) request has been read
953  * from the connection. An attacker may have sent further
954  * data to "prefix" any subsequent request by the victim's
955  * client after the renegotiation; this data may already
956  * have been read and buffered. Forcing a connection
957  * closure after the response ensures such data will be
958  * discarded. Legimately pipelined HTTP requests will be
959  * retried anyway with this approach. */
960  if (has_buffered_data(r)) {
961  ap_log_rerror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_ERR, 0, r, APLOGNO(02259)
962  "insecure SSL re-negotiation required, but "
963  "a pipelined request is present; keepalive "
964  "disabled");
965  r->connection->keepalive = AP_CONN_CLOSE;
966  }
967 
968 #if defined(SSL_get_secure_renegotiation_support)
969  reneg_support = SSL_get_secure_renegotiation_support(ssl) ?
970  "client does" : "client does not";
971 #else
972  reneg_support = "server does not";
973 #endif
974  /* Perform a full renegotiation. */
975  ap_log_rerror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_DEBUG, 0, r, APLOGNO(02260)
976  "Performing full renegotiation: complete handshake "
977  "protocol (%s support secure renegotiation)",
978  reneg_support);
979 
980  SSL_set_session_id_context(ssl,
981  (unsigned char *)&id,
982  sizeof(id));
983 
984  /* Toggle the renegotiation state to allow the new
985  * handshake to proceed. */
986  sslconn->reneg_state = RENEG_ALLOW;
987 
988  SSL_renegotiate(ssl);
989  SSL_do_handshake(ssl);
990 
991  if (!SSL_is_init_finished(ssl)) {
992  ap_log_rerror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_ERR, 0, r, APLOGNO(02225)
993  "Re-negotiation request failed");
994  ssl_log_ssl_error(SSLLOG_MARK, APLOG_ERR, r->server);
995 
996  r->connection->keepalive = AP_CONN_CLOSE;
997  return HTTP_FORBIDDEN;
998  }
999 
1000  ap_log_rerror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_INFO, 0, r, APLOGNO(02226)
1001  "Awaiting re-negotiation handshake");
1002 
1003  /* XXX: Should replace setting state with SSL_renegotiate(ssl);
1004  * However, this causes failures in perl-framework currently,
1005  * perhaps pre-test if we have already negotiated?
1006  */
1007  /* Need to trigger renegotiation handshake by reading.
1008  * Peeking 0 bytes actually works.
1009  * See: http://marc.info/?t=145493359200002&r=1&w=2
1010  */
1011  SSL_peek(ssl, peekbuf, 0);
1012 
1013  sslconn->reneg_state = RENEG_REJECT;
1014 
1015  if (!SSL_is_init_finished(ssl)) {
1016  ap_log_rerror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_ERR, 0, r, APLOGNO(02261)
1017  "Re-negotiation handshake failed");
1018  ssl_log_ssl_error(SSLLOG_MARK, APLOG_ERR, r->server);
1019 
1020  r->connection->keepalive = AP_CONN_CLOSE;
1021  return HTTP_FORBIDDEN;
1022  }
1023 
1024  /* Full renegotiation successful, we now have handshaken with
1025  * this server's parameters.
1026  */
1027  sslconn->server = r->server;
1028  }
1029 
1030  /*
1031  * Remember the peer certificate's DN
1032  */
1033  if ((cert = SSL_get_peer_certificate(ssl))) {
1034  if (sslconn->client_cert) {
1035  X509_free(sslconn->client_cert);
1036  }
1037  sslconn->client_cert = cert;
1038  sslconn->client_dn = NULL;
1039  }
1040 
1041  /*
1042  * Finally check for acceptable renegotiation results
1043  */
1044  if ((dc->nVerifyClient != SSL_CVERIFY_NONE) ||
1045  (sc->server->auth.verify_mode != SSL_CVERIFY_NONE)) {
1046  BOOL do_verify = ((dc->nVerifyClient == SSL_CVERIFY_REQUIRE) ||
1047  (sc->server->auth.verify_mode == SSL_CVERIFY_REQUIRE));
1048 
1049  if (do_verify && (SSL_get_verify_result(ssl) != X509_V_OK)) {
1050  ap_log_rerror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_ERR, 0, r, APLOGNO(02262)
1051  "Re-negotiation handshake failed: "
1052  "Client verification failed");
1053 
1054  return HTTP_FORBIDDEN;
1055  }
1056 
1057  if (do_verify) {
1058  if ((peercert = SSL_get_peer_certificate(ssl)) == NULL) {
1059  ap_log_rerror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_ERR, 0, r, APLOGNO(02263)
1060  "Re-negotiation handshake failed: "
1061  "Client certificate missing");
1062 
1063  return HTTP_FORBIDDEN;
1064  }
1065 
1066  X509_free(peercert);
1067  }
1068  }
1069 
1070  /*
1071  * Also check that SSLCipherSuite has been enforced as expected.
1072  */
1073  if (cipher_list) {
1074  cipher = SSL_get_current_cipher(ssl);
1075  if (sk_SSL_CIPHER_find(cipher_list, cipher) < 0) {
1076  ap_log_rerror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_ERR, 0, r, APLOGNO(02264)
1077  "SSL cipher suite not renegotiated: "
1078  "access to %s denied using cipher %s",
1079  r->filename,
1080  SSL_CIPHER_get_name(cipher));
1081  return HTTP_FORBIDDEN;
1082  }
1083  }
1084  /* remember any new cipher suite used in renegotiation */
1085  if (ncipher_suite) {
1086  sslconn->cipher_suite = ncipher_suite;
1087  }
1088  }
1089 
1090  /* If we're trying to have the user name set from a client
1091  * certificate then we need to set it here. This should be safe as
1092  * the user name probably isn't important from an auth checking point
1093  * of view as the certificate supplied acts in that capacity.
1094  * However, if FakeAuth is being used then this isn't the case so
1095  * we need to postpone setting the username until later.
1096  */
1097  if ((dc->nOptions & SSL_OPT_FAKEBASICAUTH) == 0 && dc->szUserName) {
1098  char *val = ssl_var_lookup(r->pool, r->server, r->connection,
1099  r, (char *)dc->szUserName);
1100  if (val && val[0])
1101  r->user = val;
1102  else
1103  ap_log_rerror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_WARNING, 0, r, APLOGNO(02227)
1104  "Failed to set r->user to '%s'", dc->szUserName);
1105  }
1106 
1107  /*
1108  * Check SSLRequire boolean expressions
1109  */
1110  requires = dc->aRequirement;
1111  ssl_requires = (ssl_require_t *)requires->elts;
1112 
1113  for (i = 0; i < requires->nelts; i++) {
1114  ssl_require_t *req = &ssl_requires[i];
1115  const char *errstring;
1116  ok = ap_expr_exec(r, req->mpExpr, &errstring);
1117 
1118  if (ok < 0) {
1119  ap_log_rerror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_ERR, 0, r, APLOGNO(02265)
1120  "access to %s failed, reason: Failed to execute "
1121  "SSL requirement expression: %s",
1122  r->filename, errstring);
1123 
1124  /* remember forbidden access for strict require option */
1125  apr_table_setn(r->notes, "ssl-access-forbidden", "1");
1126 
1127  return HTTP_FORBIDDEN;
1128  }
1129 
1130  if (ok != 1) {
1131  ap_log_rerror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_INFO, 0, r, APLOGNO(02266)
1132  "Access to %s denied for %s "
1133  "(requirement expression not fulfilled)",
1134  r->filename, r->useragent_ip);
1135 
1136  ap_log_rerror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_INFO, 0, r, APLOGNO(02228)
1137  "Failed expression: %s", req->cpExpr);
1138 
1139  ap_log_rerror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_ERR, 0, r, APLOGNO(02229)
1140  "access to %s failed, reason: %s",
1141  r->filename,
1142  "SSL requirement expression not fulfilled");
1143 
1144  /* remember forbidden access for strict require option */
1145  apr_table_setn(r->notes, "ssl-access-forbidden", "1");
1146 
1147  return HTTP_FORBIDDEN;
1148  }
1149  }
1150 
1151  /*
1152  * Else access is granted from our point of view (except vendor
1153  * handlers override). But we have to return DECLINED here instead
1154  * of OK, because mod_auth and other modules still might want to
1155  * deny access.
1156  */
1157 
1158  return DECLINED;
1159 }

int ssl_hook_Auth ( request_rec *  )

Apache API hooks

void ssl_hook_ConfigTest ( apr_pool_t *  pconf,
server_rec *  s 
)
2003 {
2004  apr_file_t *out = NULL;
2005  if (!ap_exists_config_define("DUMP_CERTS")) {
2006  return;
2007  }
2008  apr_file_open_stdout(&out, pconf);
2009  apr_file_printf(out, "Server certificates:\n");
2010 
2011  /* Dump the filenames of all configured server certificates to
2012  * stdout. */
2013  while (s) {
2014  SSLSrvConfigRec *sc = mySrvConfig(s);
2015 
2016  if (sc && sc->server && sc->server->pks) {
2017  modssl_pk_server_t *const pks = sc->server->pks;
2018  int i;
2019 
2020  for (i = 0; (i < pks->cert_files->nelts) &&
2021  APR_ARRAY_IDX(pks->cert_files, i, const char *);
2022  i++) {
2023  apr_file_printf(out, " %s\n",
2024  APR_ARRAY_IDX(pks->cert_files,
2025  i, const char *));
2026  }
2027  }
2028

2030  }

Here is the caller graph for this function:

int ssl_hook_Fixup ( request_rec *  )
1329 {
1330  SSLConnRec *sslconn = myConnConfig(r->connection);
1331  SSLSrvConfigRec *sc = mySrvConfig(r->server);
1332  SSLDirConfigRec *dc = myDirConfig(r);
1333  apr_table_t *env = r->subprocess_env;
1334  char *var, *val = "";
1335 #ifdef HAVE_TLSEXT
1336  const char *servername;
1337 #endif
1338  STACK_OF(X509) *peer_certs;
1339  SSL *ssl;
1340  int i;
1341 
1342  if (!(sslconn && sslconn->ssl) && r->connection->master) {
1343  sslconn = myConnConfig(r->connection->master);
1344  }
1345 
1346  /*
1347  * Check to see if SSL is on
1348  */
1349  if (!(((sc->enabled == SSL_ENABLED_TRUE) || (sc->enabled == SSL_ENABLED_OPTIONAL)) && sslconn && (ssl = sslconn->ssl))) {
1350  return DECLINED;
1351  }
1352 
1353  /*
1354  * Annotate the SSI/CGI environment with standard SSL information
1355  */
1356  /* the always present HTTPS (=HTTP over SSL) flag! */
1357  apr_table_setn(env, "HTTPS", "on");
1358 
1359 #ifdef HAVE_TLSEXT
1360  /* add content of SNI TLS extension (if supplied with ClientHello) */
1361  if ((servername = SSL_get_servername(ssl, TLSEXT_NAMETYPE_host_name))) {
1362  apr_table_set(env, "SSL_TLS_SNI", servername);
1363  }
1364 #endif
1365 
1366  /* standard SSL environment variables */
1367  if (dc->nOptions & SSL_OPT_STDENVVARS) {
1368  modssl_var_extract_dns(env, ssl, r->pool);
1369  modssl_var_extract_san_entries(env, ssl, r->pool);
1370 
1371  for (i = 0; ssl_hook_Fixup_vars[i]; i++) {
1372  var = (char *)ssl_hook_Fixup_vars[i];
1373  val = ssl_var_lookup(r->pool, r->server, r->connection, r, var);
1374  if (!strIsEmpty(val)) {
1375  apr_table_setn(env, var, val);
1376  }
1377  }
1378  }
1379 
1380  /*
1381  * On-demand bloat up the SSI/CGI environment with certificate data
1382  */
1383  if (dc->nOptions & SSL_OPT_EXPORTCERTDATA) {
1384  val = ssl_var_lookup(r->pool, r->server, r->connection,
1385  r, "SSL_SERVER_CERT");
1386 
1387  apr_table_setn(env, "SSL_SERVER_CERT", val);
1388 
1389  val = ssl_var_lookup(r->pool, r->server, r->connection,
1390  r, "SSL_CLIENT_CERT");
1391 
1392  apr_table_setn(env, "SSL_CLIENT_CERT", val);
1393 
1394  if ((peer_certs = (STACK_OF(X509) *)SSL_get_peer_cert_chain(ssl))) {
1395  for (i = 0; i < sk_X509_num(peer_certs); i++) {
1396  var = apr_psprintf(r->pool, "SSL_CLIENT_CERT_CHAIN_%d", i);
1397  val = ssl_var_lookup(r->pool, r->server, r->connection,
1398  r, var);
1399  if (val) {
1400  apr_table_setn(env, var, val);
1401  }
1402  }
1403  }
1404  }
1405 
1406 
1407 #ifdef SSL_get_secure_renegotiation_support
1408  apr_table_setn(r->notes, "ssl-secure-reneg",
1409  SSL_get_secure_renegotiation_support(ssl) ? "1" : "0");
1410 #endif
1411 
1412  return DECLINED;
1413 }

int ssl_hook_ReadReq ( request_rec *  )
225 {
226  SSLSrvConfigRec *sc = mySrvConfig(r->server);
227  SSLConnRec *sslconn;
228  const char *upgrade;
229 #ifdef HAVE_TLSEXT
230  const char *servername;
231 #endif
232  SSL *ssl;
233 
234  /* Perform TLS upgrade here if "SSLEngine optional" is configured,
235  * SSL is not already set up for this connection, and the client
236  * has sent a suitable Upgrade header. */
237  if (sc->enabled == SSL_ENABLED_OPTIONAL && !myConnConfig(r->connection)
238  && (upgrade = apr_table_get(r->headers_in, "Upgrade")) != NULL
239  && ap_find_token(r->pool, upgrade, "TLS/1.0")) {
240  if (upgrade_connection(r)) {
241  return AP_FILTER_ERROR;
242  }
243  }
244 
245  /* If we are on a slave connection, we do not expect to have an SSLConnRec,
246  * but our master connection might. */
247  sslconn = myConnConfig(r->connection);
248  if (!(sslconn && sslconn->ssl) && r->connection->master) {
249  sslconn = myConnConfig(r->connection->master);
250  }
251 
252  /* If "SSLEngine optional" is configured, this is not an SSL
253  * connection, and this isn't a subrequest, send an Upgrade
254  * response header. Note this must happen before map_to_storage
255  * and OPTIONS * request processing is completed.
256  */
257  if (sc->enabled == SSL_ENABLED_OPTIONAL && !(sslconn && sslconn->ssl)
258  && !r->main) {
259  apr_table_setn(r->headers_out, "Upgrade", "TLS/1.0, HTTP/1.1");
260  apr_table_mergen(r->headers_out, "Connection", "upgrade");
261  }
262 
263  if (!sslconn) {
264  return DECLINED;
265  }
266 
267  if (sslconn->non_ssl_request == NON_SSL_SET_ERROR_MSG) {
268  apr_table_setn(r->notes, "error-notes",
269  "Reason: You're speaking plain HTTP to an SSL-enabled "
270  "server port.<br />\n Instead use the HTTPS scheme to "
271  "access this URL, please.<br />\n");
272 
273  /* Now that we have caught this error, forget it. we are done
274  * with using SSL on this request.
275  */
276  sslconn->non_ssl_request = NON_SSL_OK;
277 
278  return HTTP_BAD_REQUEST;
279  }
280 
281  /*
282  * Get the SSL connection structure and perform the
283  * delayed interlinking from SSL back to request_rec
284  */
285  ssl = sslconn->ssl;
286  if (!ssl) {
287  return DECLINED;
288  }
289 #ifdef HAVE_TLSEXT
290  /*
291  * Perform SNI checks only on the initial request. In particular,
292  * if these checks detect a problem, the checks shouldn't return an
293  * error again when processing an ErrorDocument redirect for the
294  * original problem.
295  */
296  if (r->proxyreq != PROXYREQ_PROXY && ap_is_initial_req(r)) {
297  server_rec *handshakeserver = sslconn->server;
298  SSLSrvConfigRec *hssc = mySrvConfig(handshakeserver);
299 
300  if ((servername = SSL_get_servername(ssl, TLSEXT_NAMETYPE_host_name))) {
301  /*
302  * The SNI extension supplied a hostname. So don't accept requests
303  * with either no hostname or a hostname that selected a different
304  * virtual host than the one used for the handshake, causing
305  * different SSL parameters to be applied, such as SSLProtocol,
306  * SSLCACertificateFile/Path and SSLCADNRequestFile/Path which
307  * cannot be renegotiated (SSLCA* due to current limitations in
308  * OpenSSL, see:
309  * http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/httpd-dev/200806.mbox/%3C48592955.2090303@velox.ch%3E
310  * and
311  * http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/httpd-dev/201312.mbox/%3CCAKQ1sVNpOrdiBm-UPw1hEdSN7YQXRRjeaT-MCWbW_7mN%3DuFiOw%40mail.gmail.com%3E
312  * )
313  */
314  if (!r->hostname) {
315  ap_log_error(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_ERR, 0, r->server, APLOGNO(02031)
316  "Hostname %s provided via SNI, but no hostname"
317  " provided in HTTP request", servername);
318  return HTTP_BAD_REQUEST;
319  }
320  if (r->server != handshakeserver
321  && !ssl_server_compatible(sslconn->server, r->server)) {
322  /*
323  * The request does not select the virtual host that was
324  * selected by the SNI and its SSL parameters are different
325  */
326 
327  ap_log_error(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_ERR, 0, r->server, APLOGNO(02032)
328  "Hostname %s provided via SNI and hostname %s provided"
329  " via HTTP have no compatible SSL setup",
330  servername, r->hostname);
331  return HTTP_MISDIRECTED_REQUEST;
332  }
333  }
334  else if (((sc->strict_sni_vhost_check == SSL_ENABLED_TRUE)
335  || hssc->strict_sni_vhost_check == SSL_ENABLED_TRUE)
336  && r->connection->vhost_lookup_data) {
337  /*
338  * We are using a name based configuration here, but no hostname was
339  * provided via SNI. Don't allow that if are requested to do strict
340  * checking. Check whether this strict checking was set up either in the
341  * server config we used for handshaking or in our current server.
342  * This should avoid insecure configuration by accident.
343  */
344  ap_log_error(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_ERR, 0, r->server, APLOGNO(02033)
345  "No hostname was provided via SNI for a name based"
346  " virtual host");
347  apr_table_setn(r->notes, "error-notes",
348  "Reason: The client software did not provide a "
349  "hostname using Server Name Indication (SNI), "
350  "which is required to access this server.<br />\n");
351  return HTTP_FORBIDDEN;
352  }
353  }
354 #endif
355  modssl_set_app_data2(ssl, r);
356 
357  /*
358  * Log information about incoming HTTPS requests
359  */
360  if (APLOGrinfo(r) && ap_is_initial_req(r)) {
361  ap_log_rerror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_DEBUG, 0, r, APLOGNO(02034)
362  "%s HTTPS request received for child %ld (server %s)",
363  (r->connection->keepalives <= 0 ?
364  "Initial (No.1)" :
365  apr_psprintf(r->pool, "Subsequent (No.%d)",
366  r->connection->keepalives+1)),
367  r->connection->id,
368  ssl_util_vhostid(r->pool, r->server));
369  }
370 
371  /* SetEnvIf ssl-*-shutdown flags can only be per-server,
372  * so they won't change across keepalive requests
373  */
374  if (sslconn->shutdown_type == SSL_SHUTDOWN_TYPE_UNSET) {
375  ssl_configure_env(r, sslconn);
376  }
377 
378  return DECLINED;
379 }
