int ssl_hook_Upgrade ( request_rec *  )
int ssl_hook_UserCheck ( request_rec *  )
1171 {
1172  SSLConnRec *sslconn = myConnConfig(r->connection);
1173  SSLSrvConfigRec *sc = mySrvConfig(r->server);
1174  SSLDirConfigRec *dc = myDirConfig(r);
1175  char *clientdn;
1176  const char *auth_line, *username, *password;
1177 
1178  /*
1179  * Additionally forbid access (again)
1180  * when strict require option is used.
1181  */
1182  if ((dc->nOptions & SSL_OPT_STRICTREQUIRE) &&
1183  (apr_table_get(r->notes, "ssl-access-forbidden")))
1184  {
1185  return HTTP_FORBIDDEN;
1186  }
1187 
1188  /*
1189  * We decline when we are in a subrequest. The Authorization header
1190  * would already be present if it was added in the main request.
1191  */
1192  if (!ap_is_initial_req(r)) {
1193  return DECLINED;
1194  }
1195 
1196  /*
1197  * Make sure the user is not able to fake the client certificate
1198  * based authentication by just entering an X.509 Subject DN
1199  * ("/XX=YYY/XX=YYY/..") as the username and "password" as the
1200  * password.
1201  */
1202  if ((auth_line = apr_table_get(r->headers_in, "Authorization"))) {
1203  if (strcEQ(ap_getword(r->pool, &auth_line, ' '), "Basic")) {
1204  while ((*auth_line == ' ') || (*auth_line == '\t')) {
1205  auth_line++;
1206  }
1207 
1208  auth_line = ap_pbase64decode(r->pool, auth_line);
1209  username = ap_getword_nulls(r->pool, &auth_line, ':');
1210  password = auth_line;
1211 
1212  if ((username[0] == '/') && strEQ(password, "password")) {
1213  ap_log_rerror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_ERR, 0, r, APLOGNO(02035)
1214  "Encountered FakeBasicAuth spoof: %s", username);
1215  return HTTP_FORBIDDEN;
1216  }
1217  }
1218  }
1219 
1220  /*
1221  * We decline operation in various situations...
1222  * - SSLOptions +FakeBasicAuth not configured
1223  * - r->user already authenticated
1224  * - ssl not enabled
1225  * - client did not present a certificate
1226  */
1227  if (!((sc->enabled == SSL_ENABLED_TRUE || sc->enabled == SSL_ENABLED_OPTIONAL)
1228  && sslconn && sslconn->ssl && sslconn->client_cert) ||
1229  !(dc->nOptions & SSL_OPT_FAKEBASICAUTH) || r->user)
1230  {
1231  return DECLINED;
1232  }
1233 
1234  if (!sslconn->client_dn) {
1235  X509_NAME *name = X509_get_subject_name(sslconn->client_cert);
1236  char *cp = X509_NAME_oneline(name, NULL, 0);
1237  sslconn->client_dn = apr_pstrdup(r->connection->pool, cp);
1238  OPENSSL_free(cp);
1239  }
1240 
1241  clientdn = (char *)sslconn->client_dn;
1242 
1243  /*
1244  * Fake a password - which one would be immaterial, as, it seems, an empty
1245  * password in the users file would match ALL incoming passwords, if only
1246  * we were using the standard crypt library routine. Unfortunately, OpenSSL
1247  * "fixes" a "bug" in crypt and thus prevents blank passwords from
1248  * working. (IMHO what they really fix is a bug in the users of the code
1249  * - failing to program correctly for shadow passwords). We need,
1250  * therefore, to provide a password. This password can be matched by
1251  * adding the string "xxj31ZMTZzkVA" as the password in the user file.
1252  * This is just the crypted variant of the word "password" ;-)
1253  */
1254  auth_line = apr_pstrcat(r->pool, "Basic ",
1255  ap_pbase64encode(r->pool,
1256  apr_pstrcat(r->pool, clientdn,
1257  ":password", NULL)),
1258  NULL);
1259  apr_table_setn(r->headers_in, "Authorization", auth_line);
1260 
1261  ap_log_rerror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_INFO, 0, r, APLOGNO(02036)
1262  "Faking HTTP Basic Auth header: \"Authorization: %s\"",
1263  auth_line);
1264 
1265  return DECLINED;
1266 }

apr_status_t ssl_init_CheckServers ( server_rec *  ,
apr_pool_t *   
)
1730 {
1731  server_rec *s;
1732  SSLSrvConfigRec *sc;
1733 #ifndef HAVE_TLSEXT
1734  server_rec *ps;
1735  apr_hash_t *table;
1736  const char *key;
1737  apr_ssize_t klen;
1738 
1739  BOOL conflict = FALSE;
1740 #endif
1741 
1742  /*
1743  * Give out warnings when a server has HTTPS configured
1744  * for the HTTP port or vice versa
1745  */
1746  for (s = base_server; s; s = s->next) {
1747  sc = mySrvConfig(s);
1748 
1749  if ((sc->enabled == SSL_ENABLED_TRUE) && (s->port == DEFAULT_HTTP_PORT)) {
1750  ap_log_error(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_WARNING, 0,
1751  base_server, APLOGNO(01915)
1752  "Init: (%s) You configured HTTPS(%d) "
1753  "on the standard HTTP(%d) port!",
1754  ssl_util_vhostid(p, s),
1755  DEFAULT_HTTPS_PORT, DEFAULT_HTTP_PORT);
1756  }
1757 
1758  if ((sc->enabled == SSL_ENABLED_FALSE) && (s->port == DEFAULT_HTTPS_PORT)) {
1759  ap_log_error(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_WARNING, 0,
1760  base_server, APLOGNO(01916)
1761  "Init: (%s) You configured HTTP(%d) "
1762  "on the standard HTTPS(%d) port!",
1763  ssl_util_vhostid(p, s),
1764  DEFAULT_HTTP_PORT, DEFAULT_HTTPS_PORT);
1765  }
1766  }
1767 
1768 #ifndef HAVE_TLSEXT
1769  /*
1770  * Give out warnings when more than one SSL-aware virtual server uses the
1771  * same IP:port and an OpenSSL version without support for TLS extensions
1772  * (SNI in particular) is used.
1773  */
1774  table = apr_hash_make(p);
1775 
1776  for (s = base_server; s; s = s->next) {
1777  char *addr;
1778 
1779  sc = mySrvConfig(s);
1780 
1781  if (!((sc->enabled == SSL_ENABLED_TRUE) && s->addrs)) {
1782  continue;
1783  }
1784 
1785  apr_sockaddr_ip_get(&addr, s->addrs->host_addr);
1786  key = apr_psprintf(p, "%s:%u", addr, s->addrs->host_port);
1787  klen = strlen(key);
1788 
1789  if ((ps = (server_rec *)apr_hash_get(table, key, klen))) {
1790  ap_log_error(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_WARNING, 0, base_server, APLOGNO(02662)
1791  "Init: SSL server IP/port conflict: "
1792  "%s (%s:%d) vs. %s (%s:%d)",
1793  ssl_util_vhostid(p, s),
1794  (s->defn_name ? s->defn_name : "unknown"),
1795  s->defn_line_number,
1796  ssl_util_vhostid(p, ps),
1797  (ps->defn_name ? ps->defn_name : "unknown"),
1798  ps->defn_line_number);
1799  conflict = TRUE;
1800  continue;
1801  }
1802 
1803  apr_hash_set(table, key, klen, s);
1804  }
1805 
1806  if (conflict) {
1807  ap_log_error(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_WARNING, 0, base_server, APLOGNO(01917)
1808  "Init: Name-based SSL virtual hosts require "
1809  "an OpenSSL version with support for TLS extensions "
1810  "(RFC 6066 - Server Name Indication / SNI), "
1811  "but the currently used library version (%s) is "
1812  "lacking this feature", MODSSL_LIBRARY_DYNTEXT);
1813  }
1814 #endif
1815 
1816  return APR_SUCCESS;
1817 }

void ssl_init_Child ( apr_pool_t *  ,
server_rec *   
)
1932 {
1933  SSLModConfigRec *mc = myModConfig(s);
1934  mc->pid = getpid(); /* only call getpid() once per-process */
1935 
1936  /* XXX: there should be an ap_srand() function */
1937  srand((unsigned int)time(NULL));
1938

Definition: ap_mpm.h:109
time
this overrides any other settings See the pcrepattern page for details of the special character sequences In the PCRE documentation the word newline is used to mean the char acter or pair of characters that indicate a line break The choice of newline convention affects the handling of the and dollar the handling of CRLF is a recognized line ending the match position advance ment for a non anchored pattern There is more detail about this in the section on nor does it affect what R which is controlled in a similar but by separate options MULTITHREADING The PCRE functions can be used in multi threading with the proviso that the memory management functions pointed to by and and the callout and stack checking functions pointed to by pcre_callout and are shared by all threads The compiled form of a regular expression is not altered during match so the same compiled pattern can safely be used by several threads at once If the just in time optimization feature is being it needs sepa rate memory stack areas for each thread See the pcrejit documentation for more details SAVING PRECOMPILED PATTERNS FOR LATER USE The compiled form of a regular expression can be saved and re used at a later time
Definition: pcre.txt:1865

apr_status_t ssl_init_ConfigureServer ( server_rec *  ,
apr_pool_t *  ,
apr_pool_t *  ,
SSLSrvConfigRec *  ,
apr_array_header_t *   
)
1700 {
1701  apr_status_t rv;
1702 
1703  /* Initialize the server if SSL is enabled or optional.
1704  */
1705  if ((sc->enabled == SSL_ENABLED_TRUE) || (sc->enabled == SSL_ENABLED_OPTIONAL)) {
1706  ap_log_error(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_INFO, 0, s, APLOGNO(01914)
1707  "Configuring server %s for SSL protocol", sc->vhost_id);
1708  if ((rv = ssl_init_server_ctx(s, p, ptemp, sc, pphrases))
1709  != APR_SUCCESS) {
1710  return rv;
1711  }
1712 
1713  /* Initialize OCSP Responder certificate if OCSP enabled */
1714  #ifndef OPENSSL_NO_OCSP
1715  ssl_init_ocsp_certificates(s, sc->server);
1716  #endif
1717 
1718  }
1719 
1720  if (sc->proxy_enabled) {
1721  if ((rv = ssl_init_proxy_ctx(s, p, ptemp, sc)) != APR_SUCCESS) {
1722  return rv;
1723  }
1724  }
1725 
1726  return APR_SUCCESS;
1727 }

Here is the caller graph for this function:

apr_status_t ssl_init_Module ( apr_pool_t *  ,
apr_pool_t *  ,
apr_pool_t *  ,
server_rec *   
)

module initialization

173 {
174  SSLModConfigRec *mc = myModConfig(base_server);
175  SSLSrvConfigRec *sc;
176  server_rec *s;
177  apr_status_t rv;
178  apr_array_header_t *pphrases;
179 
180  if (SSLeay() < MODSSL_LIBRARY_VERSION) {
181  ap_log_error(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_WARNING, 0, base_server, APLOGNO(01882)
182  "Init: this version of mod_ssl was compiled against "
183  "a newer library (%s, version currently loaded is %s)"
184  " - may result in undefined or erroneous behavior",
185  MODSSL_LIBRARY_TEXT, MODSSL_LIBRARY_DYNTEXT);
186  }
187 
188  /* We initialize mc->pid per-process in the child init,
189  * but it should be initialized for startup before we
190  * call ssl_rand_seed() below.
191  */
192  mc->pid = getpid();
193 
194  /*
195  * Let us cleanup on restarts and exits
196  */
197  apr_pool_cleanup_register(p, base_server,
198  ssl_init_ModuleKill,
199  apr_pool_cleanup_null);
200 
201  /*
202  * Any init round fixes the global config
203  */
204  ssl_config_global_create(base_server); /* just to avoid problems */
205  ssl_config_global_fix(mc);
206 
207  /*
208  * try to fix the configuration and open the dedicated SSL
209  * logfile as early as possible
210  */
211  for (s = base_server; s; s = s->next) {
212  sc = mySrvConfig(s);
213 
214  if (sc->server) {
215  sc->server->sc = sc;
216  }
217 
218  if (sc->proxy) {
219  sc->proxy->sc = sc;
220  }
221 
222  /*
223  * Create the server host:port string because we need it a lot
224  */
225  sc->vhost_id = ssl_util_vhostid(p, s);
226  sc->vhost_id_len = strlen(sc->vhost_id);
227 
228  /* Default to enabled if SSLEngine is not set explicitly, and
229  * the protocol is https. */
230  if (ap_get_server_protocol(s)
231  && strcmp("https", ap_get_server_protocol(s)) == 0
232  && sc->enabled == SSL_ENABLED_UNSET) {
233  sc->enabled = SSL_ENABLED_TRUE;
234  }
235 
236  /* Fix up stuff that may not have been set. If sc->enabled is
237  * UNSET, then SSL is disabled on this vhost. */
238  if (sc->enabled == SSL_ENABLED_UNSET) {
239  sc->enabled = SSL_ENABLED_FALSE;
240  }
241  if (sc->proxy_enabled == UNSET) {
242  sc->proxy_enabled = FALSE;
243  }
244 
245  if (sc->session_cache_timeout == UNSET) {
246  sc->session_cache_timeout = SSL_SESSION_CACHE_TIMEOUT;
247  }
248 
249  if (sc->server && sc->server->pphrase_dialog_type == SSL_PPTYPE_UNSET) {
250  sc->server->pphrase_dialog_type = SSL_PPTYPE_BUILTIN;
251  }
252 
253 #ifdef HAVE_FIPS
254  if (sc->fips == UNSET) {
255  sc->fips = FALSE;
256  }
257 #endif
258  }
259 
260 #if APR_HAS_THREADS && MODSSL_USE_OPENSSL_PRE_1_1_API
261  ssl_util_thread_setup(p);
262 #endif
263 
264  /*
265  * SSL external crypto device ("engine") support
266  */
267 #if defined(HAVE_OPENSSL_ENGINE_H) && defined(HAVE_ENGINE_INIT)
268  if ((rv = ssl_init_Engine(base_server, p)) != APR_SUCCESS) {
269  return rv;
270  }
271 #endif
272 
273  ap_log_error(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_INFO, 0, s, APLOGNO(01883)
274  "Init: Initialized %s library", MODSSL_LIBRARY_NAME);
275 
276  /*
277  * Seed the Pseudo Random Number Generator (PRNG)
278  * only need ptemp here; nothing inside allocated from the pool
279  * needs to live once we return from ssl_rand_seed().
280  */
281  ssl_rand_seed(base_server, ptemp, SSL_RSCTX_STARTUP, "Init: ");
282 
283 #ifdef HAVE_FIPS
284  if(sc->fips) {
285  if (!FIPS_mode()) {
286  if (FIPS_mode_set(1)) {
287  ap_log_error(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_NOTICE, 0, s, APLOGNO(01884)
288  "Operating in SSL FIPS mode");
289  }
290  else {
291  ap_log_error(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_EMERG, 0, s, APLOGNO(01885) "FIPS mode failed");
292  ssl_log_ssl_error(SSLLOG_MARK, APLOG_EMERG, s);
293  return ssl_die(s);
294  }
295  }
296  }
297  else {
298  ap_log_error(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_DEBUG, 0, s, APLOGNO(01886)
299  "SSL FIPS mode disabled");
300  }
301 #endif
302 
303  /*
304  * initialize the mutex handling
305  */
306  if (!ssl_mutex_init(base_server, p)) {
307  return HTTP_INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR;
308  }
309 #ifdef HAVE_OCSP_STAPLING
310  ssl_stapling_certinfo_hash_init(p);
311 #endif
312 
313  /*
314  * initialize session caching
315  */
316  if ((rv = ssl_scache_init(base_server, p)) != APR_SUCCESS) {
317  return rv;
318  }
319 
320  pphrases = apr_array_make(ptemp, 2, sizeof(char *));
321 
322  /*
323  * initialize servers
324  */
325  ap_log_error(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_INFO, 0, base_server, APLOGNO(01887)
326  "Init: Initializing (virtual) servers for SSL");
327 
328  for (s = base_server; s; s = s->next) {
329  sc = mySrvConfig(s);
330  /*
331  * Either now skip this server when SSL is disabled for
332  * it or give out some information about what we're
333  * configuring.
334  */
335 
336  /*
337  * Read the server certificate and key
338  */
339  if ((rv = ssl_init_ConfigureServer(s, p, ptemp, sc, pphrases))
340  != APR_SUCCESS) {
341  return rv;
342  }
343  }
344 
345  if (pphrases->nelts > 0) {
346  memset(pphrases->elts, 0, pphrases->elt_size * pphrases->nelts);
347  pphrases->nelts = 0;
348  ap_log_error(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_INFO, 0, s, APLOGNO(02560)
349  "Init: Wiped out the queried pass phrases from memory");
350  }
351 
352  /*
353  * Configuration consistency checks
354  */
355  if ((rv = ssl_init_CheckServers(base_server, ptemp)) != APR_SUCCESS) {
356  return rv;
357  }
358 
359  for (s = base_server; s; s = s->next) {
360  sc = mySrvConfig(s);
361 
362  if (sc->enabled == SSL_ENABLED_TRUE || sc->enabled == SSL_ENABLED_OPTIONAL) {
363  if ((rv = ssl_run_init_server(s, p, 0, sc->server->ssl_ctx)) != APR_SUCCESS) {
364  return rv;
365  }
366  }
367  else if (sc->proxy_enabled == SSL_ENABLED_TRUE) {
368  if ((rv = ssl_run_init_server(s, p, 1, sc->proxy->ssl_ctx)) != APR_SUCCESS) {
369  return rv;
370  }
371  }
372  }
373 
374  /*
375  * Announce mod_ssl and SSL library in HTTP Server field
376  * as ``mod_ssl/X.X.X OpenSSL/X.X.X''
377  */
378  ssl_add_version_components(p, base_server);
379 
380  modssl_init_app_data2_idx(); /* for modssl_get_app_data2() at request time */
381 
382  init_dh_params();
383 #if !MODSSL_USE_OPENSSL_PRE_1_1_API
384  init_bio_methods();
385 #endif
386 
387  return OK;
388 }
SSL_PPTYPE_BUILTIN
Definition: ssl_private.h:421

#define APLOG_INFO
Definition: http_log.h:49
APLOG_MARK
#define APLOG_MARK

Here is the call graph for this function:

Here is the caller graph for this function:

apr_status_t ssl_init_ModuleKill ( void *  data)
1986 {
1987  SSLSrvConfigRec *sc;
1988  server_rec *base_server = (server_rec *)data;
1989  server_rec *s;
1990 
1991  /*
1992  * Drop the session cache and mutex
1993  */
1994  ssl_scache_kill(base_server);
1995 
1996  /*
1997  * Free the non-pool allocated structures
1998  * in the per-server configurations
1999  */
2000  for (s = base_server; s; s = s->next) {
2001  sc = mySrvConfig(s);
2002 
2003  ssl_init_ctx_cleanup_proxy(sc->proxy);
2004 
2005  ssl_init_ctx_cleanup(sc->server);
2006 
2007  /* Not Sure but possibly clear X509 trusted cert file */
2008  #ifndef OPENSSL_NO_OCSP
2009  sk_X509_pop_free(sc->server->ocsp_certs, X509_free);
2010  #endif
2011 
2012  }
2013 
2014 #if !MODSSL_USE_OPENSSL_PRE_1_1_API
2015  free_bio_methods();
2016 #endif
2017  free_dh_params();
2018 
2019  return APR_SUCCESS;
2020 }

void ssl_init_ocsp_certificates ( server_rec *  s,
modssl_ctx_t *  mctx 
)
396 {
397  /*
398  * Configure Trusted OCSP certificates.
399  */
400 
401  if (!mctx->ocsp_certs_file) {
402  return;
403  }
404 
405  ap_log_error(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_DEBUG, 0, s,
406  "Configuring Trusted OCSP certificates");
407 
408  mctx->ocsp_certs = modssl_read_ocsp_certificates(mctx->ocsp_certs_file);
409 
410  if (!mctx->ocsp_certs) {
411  ap_log_error(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_ERR, 0, s,
412  "Unable to configure OCSP Trusted Certificates");
413  ssl_log_ssl_error(SSLLOG_MARK, APLOG_ERR, s);
414  ssl_die(s);
415  }
416  mctx->ocsp_verify_flags |= OCSP_TRUSTOTHER;
417 }

int ssl_init_ssl_connection ( conn_rec *  c,
request_rec *  r 
)
507 {
508  SSLSrvConfigRec *sc;
509  SSL *ssl;
510  SSLConnRec *sslconn = myConnConfig(c);
511  char *vhost_md5;
512  int rc;
513  modssl_ctx_t *mctx;
514  server_rec *server;
515 
516  if (!sslconn) {
517  sslconn = ssl_init_connection_ctx(c);
518  }
519  server = sslconn->server;
520  sc = mySrvConfig(server);
521 
522  /*
523  * Seed the Pseudo Random Number Generator (PRNG)
524  */
525  ssl_rand_seed(server, c->pool, SSL_RSCTX_CONNECT, "");
526 
527  mctx = sslconn->is_proxy ? sc->proxy : sc->server;
528 
529  /*
530  * Create a new SSL connection with the configured server SSL context and
531  * attach this to the socket. Additionally we register this attachment
532  * so we can detach later.
533  */
534  if (!(sslconn->ssl = ssl = SSL_new(mctx->ssl_ctx))) {
535  ap_log_cerror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_ERR, 0, c, APLOGNO(01962)
536  "Unable to create a new SSL connection from the SSL "
537  "context");
538  ssl_log_ssl_error(SSLLOG_MARK, APLOG_ERR, server);
539 
540  c->aborted = 1;
541 
542  return DECLINED; /* XXX */
543  }
544 
545  rc = ssl_run_pre_handshake(c, ssl, sslconn->is_proxy ? 1 : 0);
546  if (rc != OK && rc != DECLINED) {
547  return rc;
548  }
549 
550  vhost_md5 = ap_md5_binary(c->pool, (unsigned char *)sc->vhost_id,
551  sc->vhost_id_len);
552 
553  if (!SSL_set_session_id_context(ssl, (unsigned char *)vhost_md5,
554  APR_MD5_DIGESTSIZE*2))
555  {
556  ap_log_cerror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_ERR, 0, c, APLOGNO(01963)
557  "Unable to set session id context to '%s'", vhost_md5);
558  ssl_log_ssl_error(SSLLOG_MARK, APLOG_ERR, server);
559 
560  c->aborted = 1;
561 
562  return DECLINED; /* XXX */
563  }
564 
565  SSL_set_app_data(ssl, c);
566  modssl_set_app_data2(ssl, NULL); /* will be request_rec */
567 
568  SSL_set_verify_result(ssl, X509_V_OK);
569 
570  ssl_io_filter_init(c, r, ssl);
571 
572  return APR_SUCCESS;
573 }

int ssl_io_buffer_fill ( request_rec *  r,
apr_size_t  maxlen 
)
1820 {
1821  conn_rec *c = r->connection;
1822  struct modssl_buffer_ctx *ctx;
1823  apr_bucket_brigade *tempb;
1824  apr_off_t total = 0; /* total length buffered */
1825  int eos = 0; /* non-zero once EOS is seen */
1826 
1827  /* Create the context which will be passed to the input filter;
1828  * containing a setaside pool and a brigade which constrain the
1829  * lifetime of the buffered data. */
1830  ctx = apr_palloc(r->pool, sizeof *ctx);
1831  ctx->bb = apr_brigade_create(r->pool, c->bucket_alloc);
1832 
1833  /* ... and a temporary brigade. */
1834  tempb = apr_brigade_create(r->pool, c->bucket_alloc);
1835 
1836  ap_log_cerror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_TRACE4, 0, c, "filling buffer, max size "
1837  "%" APR_SIZE_T_FMT " bytes", maxlen);
1838 
1839  do {
1840  apr_status_t rv;
1841  apr_bucket *e, *next;
1842 
1843  /* The request body is read from the protocol-level input
1844  * filters; the buffering filter will reinject it from that
1845  * level, allowing content/resource filters to run later, if
1846  * necessary. */
1847 
1848  rv = ap_get_brigade(r->proto_input_filters, tempb, AP_MODE_READBYTES,
1849  APR_BLOCK_READ, 8192);
1850  if (rv) {
1851  ap_log_rerror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_ERR, rv, r, APLOGNO(02015)
1852  "could not read request body for SSL buffer");
1853  return ap_map_http_request_error(rv, HTTP_INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR);
1854  }
1855 
1856  /* Iterate through the returned brigade: setaside each bucket
1857  * into the context's pool and move it into the brigade. */
1858  for (e = APR_BRIGADE_FIRST(tempb);
1859  e != APR_BRIGADE_SENTINEL(tempb) && !eos; e = next) {
1860  const char *data;
1861  apr_size_t len;
1862 
1863  next = APR_BUCKET_NEXT(e);
1864 
1865  if (APR_BUCKET_IS_EOS(e)) {
1866  eos = 1;
1867  } else if (!APR_BUCKET_IS_METADATA(e)) {
1868  rv = apr_bucket_read(e, &data, &len, APR_BLOCK_READ);
1869  if (rv != APR_SUCCESS) {
1870  ap_log_rerror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_ERR, rv, r, APLOGNO(02016)
1871  "could not read bucket for SSL buffer");
1872  return HTTP_INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR;
1873  }
1874  total += len;
1875  }
1876 
1877  rv = apr_bucket_setaside(e, r->pool);
1878  if (rv != APR_SUCCESS) {
1879  ap_log_rerror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_ERR, rv, r, APLOGNO(02017)
1880  "could not setaside bucket for SSL buffer");
1881  return HTTP_INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR;
1882  }
1883 
1884  APR_BUCKET_REMOVE(e);
1885  APR_BRIGADE_INSERT_TAIL(ctx->bb, e);
1886  }
1887 
1888  ap_log_cerror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_TRACE4, 0, c,
1889  "total of %" APR_OFF_T_FMT " bytes in buffer, eos=%d",
1890  total, eos);
1891 
1892  /* Fail if this exceeds the maximum buffer size. */
1893  if (total > maxlen) {
1894  ap_log_rerror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_ERR, 0, r, APLOGNO(02018)
1895  "request body exceeds maximum size (%" APR_SIZE_T_FMT
1896  ") for SSL buffer", maxlen);
1897  return HTTP_REQUEST_ENTITY_TOO_LARGE;
1898  }
1899 
1900  } while (!eos);
1901 
1902  apr_brigade_destroy(tempb);
1903 
1904  /* After consuming all protocol-level input, remove all protocol-level
1905  * filters. It should strictly only be necessary to remove filters
1906  * at exactly ftype == AP_FTYPE_PROTOCOL, since this filter will
1907  * precede all > AP_FTYPE_PROTOCOL anyway. */
1908  while (r->proto_input_filters->frec->ftype < AP_FTYPE_CONNECTION) {
1909  ap_remove_input_filter(r->proto_input_filters);
1910  }
1911 
1912  /* Insert the filter which will supply the buffered content. */
1913  ap_add_input_filter(ssl_io_buffer, ctx, r, c);
1914 
1915  return 0;
1916 }
apr_size_t
size_t apr_size_t
Definition: apr.h:357
HTTP_REQUEST_ENTITY_TOO_LARGE
#define HTTP_REQUEST_ENTITY_TOO_LARGE
Definition: httpd.h:523
APLOG_MARK
#define APLOG_MARK
Definition: http_log.h:283
APLOG_ERR
#define APLOG_ERR
Definition: http_log.h:46
c
conn_rec * c
Definition: http_core.h:849

long ssl_io_data_cb ( BIO *  ,
int  ,
const char *  ,
int  ,
long  ,
long   
)
2182 {
2183  SSL *ssl;
2184  conn_rec *c;
2185  server_rec *s;
2186 
2187  if ((ssl = (SSL *)BIO_get_callback_arg(bio)) == NULL)
2188  return rc;
2189  if ((c = (conn_rec *)SSL_get_app_data(ssl)) == NULL)
2190  return rc;
2191  s = mySrvFromConn(c);
2192 
2193  if ( cmd == (BIO_CB_WRITE|BIO_CB_RETURN)
2194  || cmd == (BIO_CB_READ |BIO_CB_RETURN) ) {
2195  if (rc >= 0) {
2196  ap_log_cserror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_TRACE4, 0, c, s,
2197  "%s: %s %ld/%d bytes %s BIO#%pp [mem: %pp] %s",
2198  MODSSL_LIBRARY_NAME,
2199  (cmd == (BIO_CB_WRITE|BIO_CB_RETURN) ? "write" : "read"),
2200  rc, argi, (cmd == (BIO_CB_WRITE|BIO_CB_RETURN) ? "to" : "from"),
2201  bio, argp,
2202  (argp != NULL ? "(BIO dump follows)" : "(Oops, no memory buffer?)"));
2203  if ((argp != NULL) && APLOG_CS_IS_LEVEL(c, s, APLOG_TRACE7))
2204  ssl_io_data_dump(s, argp, rc);
2205  }
2206  else {
2207  ap_log_cserror(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_TRACE4, 0, c, s,
2208  "%s: I/O error, %d bytes expected to %s on BIO#%pp [mem: %pp]",
2209  MODSSL_LIBRARY_NAME, argi,
2210  (cmd == (BIO_CB_WRITE|BIO_CB_RETURN) ? "write" : "read"),
2211  bio, argp);
2212  }
2213  }
2214  return rc;
2215 }

void ssl_io_filter_init ( conn_rec *  ,
request_rec *  r,
SSL *   
)

OCSP Stapling Support I/O

2050 {
2051  ssl_filter_ctx_t *filter_ctx;
2052 
2053  filter_ctx = apr_palloc(c->pool, sizeof(ssl_filter_ctx_t));
2054 
2055  filter_ctx->config = myConnConfig(c);
2056 
2057  ap_add_output_filter(ssl_io_coalesce, NULL, r, c);
2058 
2059  filter_ctx->pOutputFilter = ap_add_output_filter(ssl_io_filter,
2060  filter_ctx, r, c);
2061 
2062 #if MODSSL_USE_OPENSSL_PRE_1_1_API
2063  filter_ctx->pbioWrite = BIO_new(&bio_filter_out_method);
2064 #else
2065  filter_ctx->pbioWrite = BIO_new(bio_filter_out_method);
2066 #endif
2067  BIO_set_data(filter_ctx->pbioWrite, (void *)bio_filter_out_ctx_new(filter_ctx, c));
2068 
2069  /* write is non blocking for the benefit of async mpm */
2070  if (c->cs) {
2071  BIO_set_nbio(filter_ctx->pbioWrite, 1);
2072  }
2073 
2074  ssl_io_input_add_filter(filter_ctx, c, r, ssl);
2075 
2076  SSL_set_bio(ssl, filter_ctx->pbioRead, filter_ctx->pbioWrite);
2077  filter_ctx->pssl = ssl;
2078 
2079  apr_pool_cleanup_register(c->pool, (void*)filter_ctx,
2080  ssl_io_filter_cleanup, apr_pool_cleanup_null);
2081 
2082  if (APLOG_CS_IS_LEVEL(c, mySrvFromConn(c), APLOG_TRACE4)) {
2083  BIO *rbio = SSL_get_rbio(ssl),
2084  *wbio = SSL_get_wbio(ssl);
2085  BIO_set_callback(rbio, ssl_io_data_cb);
2086  BIO_set_callback_arg(rbio, (void *)ssl);
2087  if (wbio && wbio != rbio) {
2088  BIO_set_callback(wbio, ssl_io_data_cb);
2089  BIO_set_callback_arg(wbio, (void *)ssl);
2090  }
2091  }
2092 
2093  return;
2094 }

ssl_filter_ctx_t::pOutputFilter
ap_filter_t * pOutputFilter
Definition: ssl_engine_io.c:110
BIO_set_data
#define BIO_set_data(x, v)
Definition: ssl_private.h:232
NULL
this is a typedef for a structure whose contents are not externally defined It is up to the caller to free the that it does not depend on memory the complete pcre data block is not fully because it may contain a copy of the tableptr argu which is an those that are compatible with but some others as well can also be set and unset from within the the contents of the options argument specifies their settings at the start of compilation and execution The and PCRE_NO_START_OPTIMIZE options can be set at the time of matching as well as at compile time If errptr is NULL
Definition: pcre.txt:2065

Here is the call graph for this function:

Here is the caller graph for this function:

void ssl_io_filter_register ( apr_pool_t *  )
2097 {
2098  ap_register_input_filter (ssl_io_filter, ssl_io_filter_input, NULL, AP_FTYPE_CONNECTION + 5);
2099  ap_register_output_filter (ssl_io_coalesce, ssl_io_filter_coalesce, NULL, AP_FTYPE_CONNECTION + 4);
2100  ap_register_output_filter (ssl_io_filter, ssl_io_filter_output, NULL, AP_FTYPE_CONNECTION + 5);

2103

Definition: util_filter.h:180

this is a typedef for a structure whose contents are not externally defined It is up to the caller to free the that it does not depend on memory the complete pcre data block is not fully because it may contain a copy of the tableptr argu which is an those that are compatible with but some others as well can also be set and unset from within the the contents of the options argument specifies their settings at the start of compilation and execution The and PCRE_NO_START_OPTIMIZE options can be set at the time of matching as well as at compile time If errptr is NULL

Here is the caller graph for this function:

apr_status_t ssl_load_encrypted_pkey ( server_rec *  ,
apr_pool_t *  ,
int  ,
const char *  ,
apr_array_header_t **   
)

Pass Phrase Support

140 {
141  SSLModConfigRec *mc = myModConfig(s);
142  SSLSrvConfigRec *sc = mySrvConfig(s);
143  const char *key_id = asn1_table_vhost_key(mc, p, sc->vhost_id, idx);
144  EVP_PKEY *pPrivateKey = NULL;
145  ssl_asn1_t *asn1;
146  unsigned char *ucp;
147  long int length;
148  BOOL bReadable;
149  int nPassPhrase = (*pphrases)->nelts;
150  int nPassPhraseRetry = 0;
151  apr_time_t pkey_mtime = 0;
152  apr_status_t rv;
153  pphrase_cb_arg_t ppcb_arg;
154 
155  if (!pkey_file) {
156  ap_log_error(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_EMERG, 0, s, APLOGNO(02573)
157  "Init: No private key specified for %s", key_id);
158  return ssl_die(s);
159  }
160  else if ((rv = exists_and_readable(pkey_file, p, &pkey_mtime))
161  != APR_SUCCESS ) {
162  ap_log_error(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_EMERG, rv, s, APLOGNO(02574)
163  "Init: Can't open server private key file %s", pkey_file);
164  return ssl_die(s);
165  }
166 
167  ppcb_arg.s = s;
168  ppcb_arg.p = p;
169  ppcb_arg.aPassPhrase = *pphrases;
170  ppcb_arg.nPassPhraseCur = 0;
171  ppcb_arg.cpPassPhraseCur = NULL;
172  ppcb_arg.nPassPhraseDialog = 0;
173  ppcb_arg.nPassPhraseDialogCur = 0;
174  ppcb_arg.bPassPhraseDialogOnce = TRUE;
175  ppcb_arg.key_id = key_id;
176  ppcb_arg.pkey_file = pkey_file;
177 
178  /*
179  * if the private key is encrypted and SSLPassPhraseDialog
180  * is configured to "builtin" it isn't possible to prompt for
181  * a password after httpd has detached from the tty.
182  * in this case if we already have a private key and the
183  * file name/mtime hasn't changed, then reuse the existing key.
184  * we also reuse existing private keys that were encrypted for
185  * exec: and pipe: dialogs to minimize chances to snoop the
186  * password. that and pipe: dialogs might prompt the user
187  * for password, which on win32 for example could happen 4
188  * times at startup. twice for each child and twice within
189  * each since apache "restarts itself" on startup.
190  * of course this will not work for the builtin dialog if
191  * the server was started without LoadModule ssl_module
192  * configured, then restarted with it configured.
193  * but we fall through with a chance of success if the key
194  * is not encrypted or can be handled via exec or pipe dialog.
195  * and in the case of fallthrough, pkey_mtime and isatty()
196  * are used to give a better idea as to what failed.
197  */
198  if (pkey_mtime) {
199  ssl_asn1_t *asn1 = ssl_asn1_table_get(mc->tPrivateKey, key_id);
200  if (asn1 && (asn1->source_mtime == pkey_mtime)) {
201  ap_log_error(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_INFO, 0, s, APLOGNO(02575)
202  "Reusing existing private key from %s on restart",
203  ppcb_arg.pkey_file);
204  return APR_SUCCESS;
205  }
206  }
207 
208  ap_log_error(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_INFO, 0, s, APLOGNO(02576)
209  "Attempting to load encrypted (?) private key %s", key_id);
210 
211  for (;;) {
212  /*
213  * Try to read the private key file with the help of
214  * the callback function which serves the pass
215  * phrases to OpenSSL
216  */
217 
218  ppcb_arg.cpPassPhraseCur = NULL;
219 
220  /* Ensure that the error stack is empty; some SSL
221  * functions will fail spuriously if the error stack
222  * is not empty. */
223  ERR_clear_error();
224 
225  bReadable = ((pPrivateKey = modssl_read_privatekey(ppcb_arg.pkey_file,
226  NULL, ssl_pphrase_Handle_CB, &ppcb_arg)) != NULL ?
227  TRUE : FALSE);
228 
229  /*
230  * when the private key file now was readable,
231  * it's fine and we go out of the loop
232  */
233  if (bReadable)
234  break;
235 
236  /*
237  * when we have more remembered pass phrases
238  * try to reuse these first.
239  */
240  if (ppcb_arg.nPassPhraseCur < nPassPhrase) {
241  ppcb_arg.nPassPhraseCur++;
242  continue;
243  }
244 
245  /*
246  * else it's not readable and we have no more
247  * remembered pass phrases. Then this has to mean
248  * that the callback function popped up the dialog
249  * but a wrong pass phrase was entered. We give the
250  * user (but not the dialog program) a few more
251  * chances...
252  */
253 #ifndef WIN32
254  if ((sc->server->pphrase_dialog_type == SSL_PPTYPE_BUILTIN
255  || sc->server->pphrase_dialog_type == SSL_PPTYPE_PIPE)
256 #else
257  if (sc->server->pphrase_dialog_type == SSL_PPTYPE_PIPE
258 #endif
259  && ppcb_arg.cpPassPhraseCur != NULL
260  && nPassPhraseRetry < BUILTIN_DIALOG_RETRIES ) {
261  apr_file_printf(writetty, "Apache:mod_ssl:Error: Pass phrase incorrect "
262  "(%d more retr%s permitted).\n",
263  (BUILTIN_DIALOG_RETRIES-nPassPhraseRetry),
264  (BUILTIN_DIALOG_RETRIES-nPassPhraseRetry) == 1 ? "y" : "ies");
265  nPassPhraseRetry++;
266  if (nPassPhraseRetry > BUILTIN_DIALOG_BACKOFF)
267  apr_sleep((nPassPhraseRetry-BUILTIN_DIALOG_BACKOFF)
268  * 5 * APR_USEC_PER_SEC);
269  continue;
270  }
271 #ifdef WIN32
272  if (sc->server->pphrase_dialog_type == SSL_PPTYPE_BUILTIN) {
273  ap_log_error(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_EMERG, 0, s, APLOGNO(02577)
274  "Init: SSLPassPhraseDialog builtin is not "
275  "supported on Win32 (key file "
276  "%s)", ppcb_arg.pkey_file);
277  return ssl_die(s);
278  }
279 #endif /* WIN32 */
280 
281  /*
282  * Ok, anything else now means a fatal error.
283  */
284  if (ppcb_arg.cpPassPhraseCur == NULL) {
285  if (ppcb_arg.nPassPhraseDialogCur && pkey_mtime &&
286  !isatty(fileno(stdout))) /* XXX: apr_isatty() */
287  {
288  ap_log_error(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_ERR, 0,
289  s, APLOGNO(02578)
290  "Init: Unable to read pass phrase "
291  "[Hint: key introduced or changed "
292  "before restart?]");
293  ssl_log_ssl_error(SSLLOG_MARK, APLOG_ERR, s);
294  }
295  else {
296  ap_log_error(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_ERR, 0,
297  s, APLOGNO(02579) "Init: Private key not found");
298  ssl_log_ssl_error(SSLLOG_MARK, APLOG_ERR, s);
299  }
300  if (writetty) {
301  apr_file_printf(writetty, "Apache:mod_ssl:Error: Private key not found.\n");
302  apr_file_printf(writetty, "**Stopped\n");
303  }
304  }
305  else {
306  ap_log_error(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_EMERG, 0, s, APLOGNO(02580)
307  "Init: Pass phrase incorrect for key %s",
308  key_id);
309  ssl_log_ssl_error(SSLLOG_MARK, APLOG_EMERG, s);
310 
311  if (writetty) {
312  apr_file_printf(writetty, "Apache:mod_ssl:Error: Pass phrase incorrect.\n");
313  apr_file_printf(writetty, "**Stopped\n");
314  }
315  }
316  return ssl_die(s);
317  }
318 
319  if (pPrivateKey == NULL) {
320  ap_log_error(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_EMERG, 0, s, APLOGNO(02581)
321  "Init: Unable to read server private key from file %s",
322  ppcb_arg.pkey_file);
323  ssl_log_ssl_error(SSLLOG_MARK, APLOG_EMERG, s);
324  return ssl_die(s);
325  }
326 
327  /*
328  * Log the type of reading
329  */
330  if (ppcb_arg.nPassPhraseDialogCur == 0) {
331  ap_log_error(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_DEBUG, 0, s, APLOGNO(02582)
332  "unencrypted %s private key - pass phrase not "
333  "required", key_id);
334  }
335  else {
336  if (ppcb_arg.cpPassPhraseCur != NULL) {
337  ap_log_error(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_DEBUG, 0,
338  s, APLOGNO(02583)
339  "encrypted %s private key - pass phrase "
340  "requested", key_id);
341  }
342  else {
343  ap_log_error(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_DEBUG, 0,
344  s, APLOGNO(02584)
345  "encrypted %s private key - pass phrase"
346  " reused", key_id);
347  }
348  }
349 
350  /*
351  * Ok, when we have one more pass phrase store it
352  */
353  if (ppcb_arg.cpPassPhraseCur != NULL) {
354  *(const char **)apr_array_push(ppcb_arg.aPassPhrase) =
355  ppcb_arg.cpPassPhraseCur;
356  nPassPhrase++;
357  }
358 
359  /*
360  * Insert private key into the global module configuration
361  * (we convert it to a stand-alone DER byte sequence
362  * because the SSL library uses static variables inside a
363  * RSA structure which do not survive DSO reloads!)
364  */
365  length = i2d_PrivateKey(pPrivateKey, NULL);
366  ucp = ssl_asn1_table_set(mc->tPrivateKey, key_id, length);
367  (void)i2d_PrivateKey(pPrivateKey, &ucp); /* 2nd arg increments */
368 
369  if (ppcb_arg.nPassPhraseDialogCur != 0) {
370  /* remember mtime of encrypted keys */
371  asn1 = ssl_asn1_table_get(mc->tPrivateKey, key_id);
372  asn1->source_mtime = pkey_mtime;
373  }
374 
375  /*
376  * Free the private key structure
377  */
378  EVP_PKEY_free(pPrivateKey);
379 
380  /*
381  * Let the user know when we're successful.
382  */
383  if ((ppcb_arg.nPassPhraseDialog > 0) &&
384  (ppcb_arg.cpPassPhraseCur != NULL)) {
385  if (writetty) {
386  apr_file_printf(writetty, "\n"
387  "OK: Pass Phrase Dialog successful.\n");
388  }
389  }
390 
391  /* Close the pipes if they were opened
392  */
393  if (readtty) {
394  apr_file_close(readtty);
395  apr_file_close(writetty);
396  readtty = writetty = NULL;
397  }
398 
399  return APR_SUCCESS;
400 }
pphrase_cb_arg_t::aPassPhrase
apr_array_header_t * aPassPhrase

Definition: ssl_engine_log.c:84
stdout
in other force each pattern to be studied If s is all the JIT compile options are passed to pcre[16|32] causing just in time optimization to be set up if it is for both full and partial matching Specific JIT compile options can be selected by following s with a digit in the range which selects the JIT compile modes as the either specifying no studying at or suppressing JIT com pilation If the I or D option is present on a information about the result of studying is not included when studying is caused only by s and neither i nor d is present on the command line This behaviour means that the output from tests that are run with and without s should be except when options that output information about the actual running of a match are set The and tm which give information about resources are likely to produce different output with and without s Output may also differ if the C option is present on an individual pattern This uses callouts to trace the the matching and this may be different between studied and non studied patterns If the pattern contains MARK items there may also be for the same reason The s command line option can be overridden for spe cific patterns that should never be and match many times with a and output the resulting times per or because you will then get the size output a zillion and the timing will be distorted You can control the number of iterations that are used for timing by following t with a t iter ates times The default is to iterate times tm This is like t except that it times only the matching not the compile or study phases T TM These behave like t and but in at the end of a the total times for all and matches are output DESCRIPTION If pcretest is given two filename it reads from the first and writes to the second If it is given only one filename it reads from that file and writes to stdout it reads from stdin and writes to stdout

Logfile Support

85 {
86  unsigned long e;
87  const char *data;
88  int flags;
89 
90  while ((e = ERR_peek_error_line_data(NULL, NULL, &data, &flags))) {
91  const char *annotation;
92  char err[256];
93 
94  if (!(flags & ERR_TXT_STRING)) {
95  data = NULL;
96  }
97 
98  ERR_error_string_n(e, err, sizeof err);
99  annotation = ssl_log_annotation(err);
100 
101  ap_log_error(file, line, APLOG_MODULE_INDEX, level, 0, s,
102  "SSL Library Error: %s%s%s%s%s%s",
103  /* %s */
104  err,
105  /* %s%s%s */
106  data ? " (" : "", data ? data : "", data ? ")" : "",
107  /* %s%s */
108  annotation ? " -- " : "",
109  annotation ? annotation : "");
110 
111  /* Pop the error off the stack: */
112  ERR_get_error();
113  }
114 }

Mutex Support

34 {
35  SSLModConfigRec *mc = myModConfig(s);
36  apr_status_t rv;
37 
38  /* A mutex is only needed if a session cache is configured, and
39  * the provider used is not internally multi-process/thread
40  * safe. */
41  if (!mc->sesscache
42  || (mc->sesscache->flags & AP_SOCACHE_FLAG_NOTMPSAFE) == 0) {
43  return TRUE;
44  }
45 
46  if (mc->pMutex) {
47  return TRUE;
48  }
49 
50  if ((rv = ap_global_mutex_create(&mc->pMutex, NULL, SSL_CACHE_MUTEX_TYPE,
51  NULL, s, s->process->pool, 0))
52  != APR_SUCCESS) {
53  return FALSE;
54  }
55 
56  return TRUE;
57 }
FALSE
#define FALSE
Definition: ssl_private.h:71
SSLModConfigRec::sesscache
const ap_socache_provider_t * sesscache
Definition: ssl_private.h:567
SSL_CACHE_MUTEX_TYPE
#define SSL_CACHE_MUTEX_TYPE
Definition: ssl_private.h:992
apr_status_t
int apr_status_t
Definition: apr_errno.h:44

Definition: httpd.h:779

Definition: apr_memcache.h:161

Definition: ssl_private.h:570

Definition: ap_socache.h:94

int ssl_mutex_off ( server_rec *  )
100 {
101  SSLModConfigRec *mc = myModConfig(s);
102  apr_status_t rv;
103 
104  if ((rv = apr_global_mutex_unlock(mc->pMutex)) != APR_SUCCESS) {
105  ap_log_error(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_WARNING, rv, s, APLOGNO(02027)
106  "Failed to release SSL session cache lock");
107  return FALSE;
108  }
109  return TRUE;
110 }

int ssl_mutex_reinit ( server_rec *  ,
apr_pool_t *   
)
60 {
61  SSLModConfigRec *mc = myModConfig(s);
62  apr_status_t rv;
63  const char *lockfile;
64 
65  if (mc->pMutex == NULL || !mc->sesscache
66  || (mc->sesscache->flags & AP_SOCACHE_FLAG_NOTMPSAFE) == 0) {
67  return TRUE;
68  }
69 
70  lockfile = apr_global_mutex_lockfile(mc->pMutex);
71  if ((rv = apr_global_mutex_child_init(&mc->pMutex,
72  lockfile,
73  p)) != APR_SUCCESS) {
74  if (lockfile)
75  ap_log_error(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_ERR, rv, s, APLOGNO(02024)
76  "Cannot reinit %s mutex with file `%s'",
77  SSL_CACHE_MUTEX_TYPE, lockfile);
78  else
79  ap_log_error(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_WARNING, rv, s, APLOGNO(02025)
80  "Cannot reinit %s mutex", SSL_CACHE_MUTEX_TYPE);
81  return FALSE;
82  }
83  return TRUE;
84 }

Here is the caller graph for this function:

int ssl_rand_seed ( server_rec *  ,
apr_pool_t *  ,
ssl_rsctx_t  ,
char *   
)

PRNG

42 {
43  SSLModConfigRec *mc;
44  apr_array_header_t *apRandSeed;
45  ssl_randseed_t *pRandSeeds;
46  ssl_randseed_t *pRandSeed;
47  unsigned char stackdata[256];
48  int nDone;
49  apr_file_t *fp;
50  int i, n, l;
51 
52  mc = myModConfig(s);
53  nDone = 0;
54  apRandSeed = mc->aRandSeed;
55  pRandSeeds = (ssl_randseed_t *)apRandSeed->elts;
56  for (i = 0; i < apRandSeed->nelts; i++) {
57  pRandSeed = &pRandSeeds[i];
58  if (pRandSeed->nCtx == nCtx) {
59  if (pRandSeed->nSrc == SSL_RSSRC_FILE) {
60  /*
61  * seed in contents of an external file
62  */
63  if (apr_file_open(&fp, pRandSeed->cpPath,
64  APR_READ, APR_OS_DEFAULT, p) != APR_SUCCESS)
65  continue;
66  nDone += ssl_rand_feedfp(p, fp, pRandSeed->nBytes);
67  apr_file_close(fp);
68  }
69  else if (pRandSeed->nSrc == SSL_RSSRC_EXEC) {
70  const char *cmd = pRandSeed->cpPath;
71  const char **argv = apr_palloc(p, sizeof(char *) * 3);
72  /*
73  * seed in contents generated by an external program
74  */
75  argv[0] = cmd;
76  argv[1] = apr_itoa(p, pRandSeed->nBytes);
77  argv[2] = NULL;
78 
79  if ((fp = ssl_util_ppopen(s, p, cmd, argv)) == NULL)
80  continue;
81  nDone += ssl_rand_feedfp(p, fp, pRandSeed->nBytes);
82  ssl_util_ppclose(s, p, fp);
83  }
84 #ifdef HAVE_RAND_EGD
85  else if (pRandSeed->nSrc == SSL_RSSRC_EGD) {
86  /*
87  * seed in contents provided by the external
88  * Entropy Gathering Daemon (EGD)
89  */
90  if ((n = RAND_egd(pRandSeed->cpPath)) == -1)
91  continue;
92  nDone += n;
93  }
94 #endif
95  else if (pRandSeed->nSrc == SSL_RSSRC_BUILTIN) {
96  struct {
97  time_t t;
98  pid_t pid;
99  } my_seed;
100 
101  /*
102  * seed in the current time (usually just 4 bytes)
103  */
104  my_seed.t = time(NULL);
105 
106  /*
107  * seed in the current process id (usually just 4 bytes)
108  */
109  my_seed.pid = mc->pid;
110 
111  l = sizeof(my_seed);
112  RAND_seed((unsigned char *)&my_seed, l);
113  nDone += l;
114 
115  /*
116  * seed in some current state of the run-time stack (128 bytes)
117  */
118  n = ssl_rand_choosenum(0, sizeof(stackdata)-128-1);
119  RAND_seed(stackdata+n, 128);
120  nDone += 128;
121 
122  }
123  }
124  }
125  ap_log_error(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_TRACE2, 0, s,
126  "%sSeeding PRNG with %d bytes of entropy", prefix, nDone);
127 
128  if (RAND_status() == 0)
129  ap_log_error(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_WARNING, 0, s, APLOGNO(01990)
130  "%sPRNG still contains insufficient entropy!", prefix);
131 
132  return nDone;
133 }
SSL_RSSRC_BUILTIN
Definition: ssl_private.h:461

Definition: ssl_private.h:467

Definition: ap_mpm.h:109
time
this overrides any other settings See the pcrepattern page for details of the special character sequences In the PCRE documentation the word newline is used to mean the char acter or pair of characters that indicate a line break The choice of newline convention affects the handling of the and dollar the handling of CRLF is a recognized line ending the match position advance ment for a non anchored pattern There is more detail about this in the section on nor does it affect what R which is controlled in a similar but by separate options MULTITHREADING The PCRE functions can be used in multi threading with the proviso that the memory management functions pointed to by and and the callout and stack checking functions pointed to by pcre_callout and are shared by all threads The compiled form of a regular expression is not altered during match so the same compiled pattern can safely be used by several threads at once If the just in time optimization feature is being it needs sepa rate memory stack areas for each thread See the pcrejit documentation for more details SAVING PRECOMPILED PATTERNS FOR LATER USE The compiled form of a regular expression can be saved and re used at a later time
Definition: pcre.txt:1865

Here is the caller graph for this function:

apr_status_t ssl_scache_init ( server_rec *  ,
apr_pool_t *   
)

Session Cache Support

41 {
42  SSLModConfigRec *mc = myModConfig(s);
43  apr_status_t rv;
44  struct ap_socache_hints hints;
45 
46  /* The very first invocation of this function will be the
47  * post_config invocation during server startup; do nothing for
48  * this first (and only the first) time through, since the pool
49  * will be immediately cleared anyway. For every subsequent
50  * invocation, initialize the configured cache. */
51  if (ap_state_query(AP_SQ_MAIN_STATE) == AP_SQ_MS_CREATE_PRE_CONFIG)
52  return APR_SUCCESS;
53 
54 #ifdef HAVE_OCSP_STAPLING
55  if (mc->stapling_cache) {
56  memset(&hints, 0, sizeof hints);
57  hints.avg_obj_size = 1500;
58  hints.avg_id_len = 20;
59  hints.expiry_interval = 300;
60 
61  rv = mc->stapling_cache->init(mc->stapling_cache_context,
62  "mod_ssl-stapling", &hints, s, p);
63  if (rv) {
64  ap_log_error(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_EMERG, 0, s, APLOGNO(01872)
65  "Could not initialize stapling cache. Exiting.");
66  return ssl_die(s);
67  }
68  }
69 #endif
70 
71  /*
72  * Warn the user that he should use the session cache.
73  * But we can operate without it, of course.
74  */
75  if (mc->sesscache == NULL) {
76  ap_log_error(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_WARNING, 0, s, APLOGNO(01873)
77  "Init: Session Cache is not configured "
78  "[hint: SSLSessionCache]");
79  return APR_SUCCESS;
80  }
81 
82  memset(&hints, 0, sizeof hints);
83  hints.avg_obj_size = 150;
84  hints.avg_id_len = 30;
85  hints.expiry_interval = 30;
86 
87  rv = mc->sesscache->init(mc->sesscache_context, "mod_ssl-session", &hints, s, p);
88  if (rv) {
89  ap_log_error(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_EMERG, 0, s, APLOGNO(01874)
90  "Could not initialize session cache. Exiting.");
91  return ssl_die(s);
92  }
93 
94  return APR_SUCCESS;
95 }

#define APLOG_MARK

int  ,

)
178 {
179  SSLModConfigRec *mc = myModConfig(s);
180 
181  if (mc->sesscache->flags & AP_SOCACHE_FLAG_NOTMPSAFE) {
182  ssl_mutex_on(s);
183  }
184 
185  mc->sesscache->remove(mc->sesscache_context, s, id, idlen, p);
186 
187  if (mc->sesscache->flags & AP_SOCACHE_FLAG_NOTMPSAFE) {
188  ssl_mutex_off(s);

SSL_SESSION* ssl_scache_retrieve ( server_rec *  ,
IDCONST UCHAR *  ,
int  ,
apr_pool_t *   
)
149 {
150  SSLModConfigRec *mc = myModConfig(s);
151  unsigned char dest[MODSSL_SESSION_MAX_DER];
152  unsigned int destlen = MODSSL_SESSION_MAX_DER;
153  const unsigned char *ptr;
154  apr_status_t rv;
155 
156  if (mc->sesscache->flags & AP_SOCACHE_FLAG_NOTMPSAFE) {
157  ssl_mutex_on(s);
158  }
159 
160  rv = mc->sesscache->retrieve(mc->sesscache_context, s, id, idlen,
161  dest, &destlen, p);
162 
163  if (mc->sesscache->flags & AP_SOCACHE_FLAG_NOTMPSAFE) {
164  ssl_mutex_off(s);
165  }
166 
167  if (rv != APR_SUCCESS) {
168  return NULL;
169  }
170 
171  ptr = dest;
172 
173  return d2i_SSL_SESSION(NULL, &ptr, destlen);
174 }
ap_socache_provider_t::retrieve
apr_status_t(* retrieve)(ap_socache_instance_t *instance, server_rec *s, const unsigned char *id, unsigned int idlen, unsigned char *data, unsigned int *datalen, apr_pool_t *pool)

BOOL ssl_scache_store ( server_rec *  ,
IDCONST UCHAR *  ,
int  ,
apr_time_t  ,
SSL_SESSION *  ,
apr_pool_t *   
)
116 {
117  SSLModConfigRec *mc = myModConfig(s);
118  unsigned char encoded[MODSSL_SESSION_MAX_DER], *ptr;
119  unsigned int len;
120  apr_status_t rv;
121 
122  /* Serialise the session. */
123  len = i2d_SSL_SESSION(sess, NULL);
124  if (len > sizeof encoded) {
125  ap_log_error(APLOG_MARK, APLOG_ERR, 0, s, APLOGNO(01875)
126  "session is too big (%u bytes)", len);
127  return FALSE;
128  }
129 
130  ptr = encoded;
131  len = i2d_SSL_SESSION(sess, &ptr);
132 
133  if (mc->sesscache->flags & AP_SOCACHE_FLAG_NOTMPSAFE) {
134  ssl_mutex_on(s);
135  }
136 
137  rv = mc->sesscache->store(mc->sesscache_context, s, id, idlen,
138  expiry, encoded, len, p);
139 
140  if (mc->sesscache->flags & AP_SOCACHE_FLAG_NOTMPSAFE) {
141  ssl_mutex_off(s);
142  }
143 
144  return rv == APR_SUCCESS ? TRUE : FALSE;
145 }
APLOG_MARK
#define APLOG_MARK

BOOL ssl_util_path_check ( ssl_pathcheck_t  ,
const char *  ,
apr_pool_t *   
)
165 {
166  apr_finfo_t finfo;
167 
168  if (path == NULL)
169  return FALSE;
170  if (pcm & SSL_PCM_EXISTS && apr_stat(&finfo, path,
171  APR_FINFO_TYPE|APR_FINFO_SIZE, p) != 0)
172  return FALSE;
173  AP_DEBUG_ASSERT((pcm & SSL_PCM_EXISTS) ||
174  !(pcm & (SSL_PCM_ISREG|SSL_PCM_ISDIR|SSL_PCM_ISNONZERO)));
175  if (pcm & SSL_PCM_ISREG && finfo.filetype != APR_REG)
176  return FALSE;
177  if (pcm & SSL_PCM_ISDIR && finfo.filetype != APR_DIR)
178  return FALSE;
179  if (pcm & SSL_PCM_ISNONZERO && finfo.size <= 0)
180  return FALSE;
181  return TRUE;
182 }
FALSE
#define FALSE

apr_file_t* ssl_util_ppopen ( server_rec *  ,
apr_pool_t *  ,
const char *  ,
const char *const *   
)
111 {
112  apr_procattr_t *procattr;
113  apr_proc_t *proc;
114 
115  if (apr_procattr_create(&procattr, p) != APR_SUCCESS)
116  return NULL;
117  if (apr_procattr_io_set(procattr, APR_FULL_BLOCK, APR_FULL_BLOCK,
118  APR_FULL_BLOCK) != APR_SUCCESS)
119  return NULL;
120  if (apr_procattr_dir_set(procattr,
121  ap_make_dirstr_parent(p, cmd)) != APR_SUCCESS)
122  return NULL;
123  if (apr_procattr_cmdtype_set(procattr, APR_PROGRAM) != APR_SUCCESS)
124  return NULL;
125  proc = apr_pcalloc(p, sizeof(apr_proc_t));
126  if (apr_proc_create(proc, cmd, argv, NULL, procattr, p) != APR_SUCCESS)
127  return NULL;
128  return proc->out;
129 }

char* ssl_util_readfilter ( server_rec *  ,
apr_pool_t *  ,
const char *  ,
const char *const *   
)
142 {
143  static char buf[MAX_STRING_LEN];
144  apr_file_t *fp;
145  apr_size_t nbytes = 1;
146  char c;
147  int k;
148 
149  if ((fp = ssl_util_ppopen(s, p, cmd, argv)) == NULL)
150  return NULL;
151  /* XXX: we are reading 1 byte at a time here */
152  for (k = 0; apr_file_read(fp, &c, &nbytes) == APR_SUCCESS
153  && nbytes == 1 && (k < MAX_STRING_LEN-1) ; ) {
154  if (c == '\n' || c == '\r')
155  break;
156  buf[k++] = c;
157  }
158  buf[k] = NUL;
159  ssl_util_ppclose(s, p, fp);
160 
161  return buf;
162 }
apr_size_t
size_t apr_size_t
Definition: apr.h:357

Definition: apr_arch_file_io.h:97

BOOL ssl_util_vhost_matches ( const char *  servername,
server_rec *  s 
)
68 {
69  apr_array_header_t *names;
70  int i;
71 
72  /* check ServerName */
73  if (!strcasecmp(servername, s->server_hostname)) {
74  return TRUE;
75  }
76 
77  /*
78  * if not matched yet, check ServerAlias entries
79  * (adapted from vhost.c:matches_aliases())
80  */
81  names = s->names;
82  if (names) {
83  char **name = (char **)names->elts;
84  for (i = 0; i < names->nelts; ++i) {
85  if (!name[i])
86  continue;
87  if (!strcasecmp(servername, name[i])) {
88  return TRUE;
89  }
90  }
91  }
92 
93  /* if still no match, check ServerAlias entries with wildcards */
94  names = s->wild_names;
95  if (names) {
96  char **name = (char **)names->elts;
97  for (i = 0; i < names->nelts; ++i) {
98  if (!name[i])
99  continue;
100  if (!ap_strcasecmp_match(servername, name[i])) {
101  return TRUE;
102  }
103  }
104  }
105 
106  return FALSE;
107 }
name
apr_pool_t const char * name
Definition: http_config.h:800
apr_array_header_t
Definition: apr_tables.h:62
FALSE
#define FALSE
Definition: ssl_private.h:71

Definition: httpd.h:1320

Definition: httpd.h:1302

Definition: mod_proxy.h:718

char* ssl_util_vhostid ( apr_pool_t *  ,
server_rec *   
)

Utility Functions

43 {
44  char *id;
45  SSLSrvConfigRec *sc;
46  char *host;
47  apr_port_t port;
48 
49  host = s->server_hostname;
50  if (s->port != 0)
51  port = s->port;
52  else {
53  sc = mySrvConfig(s);
54  if (sc->enabled == TRUE)
55  port = DEFAULT_HTTPS_PORT;
56  else
57  port = DEFAULT_HTTP_PORT;
58  }
59  id = apr_psprintf(p, "%s:%lu", host, (unsigned long)port);
60  return id;
61 }

void ssl_var_log_config_register ( apr_pool_t *  p)

1191

Here is the call graph for this function:

char* ssl_var_lookup ( apr_pool_t *  ,
server_rec *  ,
conn_rec *  ,
request_rec *  ,
char *   
)
957 {
958  NWSSLSrvConfigRec *mc = get_nwssl_cfg(s);
959  const char *result;
960  BOOL resdup;
961  apr_time_exp_t tm;
962 
963  result = NULL;
964  resdup = TRUE;
965 
966  /*
967  * When no pool is given try to find one
968  */
969  if (p == NULL) {
970  if (r != NULL)
971  p = r->pool;
972  else if (c != NULL)
973  p = c->pool;
974  else
975  p = mc->pPool;
976  }
977 
978  /*
979  * Request dependent stuff
980  */
981  if (r != NULL) {
982  switch (var[0]) {
983  case 'H':
984  case 'h':
985  if (strcEQ(var, "HTTP_USER_AGENT"))
986  result = apr_table_get(r->headers_in, "User-Agent");
987  else if (strcEQ(var, "HTTP_REFERER"))
988  result = apr_table_get(r->headers_in, "Referer");
989  else if (strcEQ(var, "HTTP_COOKIE"))
990  result = apr_table_get(r->headers_in, "Cookie");
991  else if (strcEQ(var, "HTTP_FORWARDED"))
992  result = apr_table_get(r->headers_in, "Forwarded");
993  else if (strcEQ(var, "HTTP_HOST"))
994  result = apr_table_get(r->headers_in, "Host");
995  else if (strcEQ(var, "HTTP_PROXY_CONNECTION"))
996  result = apr_table_get(r->headers_in, "Proxy-Connection");
997  else if (strcEQ(var, "HTTP_ACCEPT"))
998  result = apr_table_get(r->headers_in, "Accept");
999  else if (strcEQ(var, "HTTPS")) {
1000  if (isSecure(r) || isSecureUpgraded(r))
1001  result = "on";
1002  else
1003  result = "off";
1004  }
1005  else if (strlen(var) > 5 && strcEQn(var, "HTTP:", 5))
1006  /* all other headers from which we are still not know about */
1007  result = apr_table_get(r->headers_in, var+5);
1008  break;
1009 
1010  case 'R':
1011  case 'r':
1012  if (strcEQ(var, "REQUEST_METHOD"))
1013  result = r->method;
1014  else if (strcEQ(var, "REQUEST_SCHEME"))
1015  result = ap_http_scheme(r);
1016  else if (strcEQ(var, "REQUEST_URI"))
1017  result = r->uri;
1018  else if (strcEQ(var, "REQUEST_FILENAME"))
1019  result = r->filename;
1020  else if (strcEQ(var, "REMOTE_ADDR"))
1021  result = r->useragent_ip;
1022  else if (strcEQ(var, "REMOTE_HOST"))
1023  result = ap_get_useragent_host(r, REMOTE_NAME, NULL);
1024  else if (strcEQ(var, "REMOTE_IDENT"))
1025  result = ap_get_remote_logname(r);
1026  else if (strcEQ(var, "REMOTE_USER"))
1027  result = r->user;
1028  break;
1029 
1030  case 'S':
1031  case 's':
1032  if (strcEQn(var, "SSL", 3)) break; /* shortcut common case */
1033 
1034  if (strcEQ(var, "SERVER_ADMIN"))
1035  result = r->server->server_admin;
1036  else if (strcEQ(var, "SERVER_NAME"))
1037  result = ap_get_server_name_for_url(r);
1038  else if (strcEQ(var, "SERVER_PORT"))
1039  result = apr_psprintf(p, "%u", ap_get_server_port(r));
1040  else if (strcEQ(var, "SERVER_PROTOCOL"))
1041  result = r->protocol;
1042  else if (strcEQ(var, "SCRIPT_FILENAME"))
1043  result = r->filename;
1044  break;
1045 
1046  default:
1047  if (strcEQ(var, "PATH_INFO"))
1048  result = r->path_info;
1049  else if (strcEQ(var, "QUERY_STRING"))
1050  result = r->args;
1051  else if (strcEQ(var, "IS_SUBREQ"))
1052  result = (r->main != NULL ? "true" : "false");
1053  else if (strcEQ(var, "DOCUMENT_ROOT"))
1054  result = ap_document_root(r);
1055  else if (strcEQ(var, "AUTH_TYPE"))
1056  result = r->ap_auth_type;
1057  else if (strcEQ(var, "THE_REQUEST"))
1058  result = r->the_request;
1059  break;
1060  }
1061  }
1062 
1063  /*
1064  * Connection stuff
1065  */
1066  if (result == NULL && c != NULL) {
1067  /* XXX-Can't get specific SSL info from NetWare */
1068  /* SSLConnRec *sslconn = myConnConfig(c);
1069  if (strlen(var) > 4 && strcEQn(var, "SSL_", 4)
1070  && sslconn && sslconn->ssl)
1071  result = ssl_var_lookup_ssl(p, c, var+4);*/
1072 
1073  if (strlen(var) > 4 && strcEQn(var, "SSL_", 4))
1074  result = NULL;
1075  }
1076 
1077  /*
1078  * Totally independent stuff
1079  */
1080  if (result == NULL) {
1081  if (strlen(var) > 12 && strcEQn(var, "SSL_VERSION_", 12))
1082  result = NULL;
1083  /* XXX-Can't get specific SSL info from NetWare */
1084  /*result = ssl_var_lookup_ssl_version(p, var+12);*/
1085  else if (strcEQ(var, "SERVER_SOFTWARE"))
1086  result = ap_get_server_banner();
1087  else if (strcEQ(var, "API_VERSION")) {
1088  result = apr_itoa(p, MODULE_MAGIC_NUMBER_MAJOR);
1089  resdup = FALSE;
1090  }
1091  else if (strcEQ(var, "TIME_YEAR")) {
1092  apr_time_exp_lt(&tm, apr_time_now());
1093  result = apr_psprintf(p, "%02d%02d",
1094  (tm.tm_year / 100) + 19, tm.tm_year % 100);
1095  resdup = FALSE;
1096  }
1097 #define MKTIMESTR(format, tmfield) \
1098  apr_time_exp_lt(&tm, apr_time_now()); \
1099  result = apr_psprintf(p, format, tm.tmfield); \
1100  resdup = FALSE;
1101  else if (strcEQ(var, "TIME_MON")) {
1102  MKTIMESTR("%02d", tm_mon+1)
1103  }
1104  else if (strcEQ(var, "TIME_DAY")) {
1105  MKTIMESTR("%02d", tm_mday)
1106  }
1107  else if (strcEQ(var, "TIME_HOUR")) {
1108  MKTIMESTR("%02d", tm_hour)
1109  }
1110  else if (strcEQ(var, "TIME_MIN")) {
1111  MKTIMESTR("%02d", tm_min)
1112  }
1113  else if (strcEQ(var, "TIME_SEC")) {
1114  MKTIMESTR("%02d", tm_sec)
1115  }
1116  else if (strcEQ(var, "TIME_WDAY")) {
1117  MKTIMESTR("%d", tm_wday)
1118  }
1119  else if (strcEQ(var, "TIME")) {
1120  apr_time_exp_lt(&tm, apr_time_now());
1121  result = apr_psprintf(p,
1122  "%02d%02d%02d%02d%02d%02d%02d", (tm.tm_year / 100) + 19,
1123  (tm.tm_year % 100), tm.tm_mon+1, tm.tm_mday,
1124  tm.tm_hour, tm.tm_min, tm.tm_sec);
1125  resdup = FALSE;
1126  }
1127  /* all other env-variables from the parent Apache process */
1128  else if (strlen(var) > 4 && strcEQn(var, "ENV:", 4)) {
1129  result = apr_table_get(r->notes, var+4);
1130  if (result == NULL)
1131  result = apr_table_get(r->subprocess_env, var+4);
1132  if (result == NULL)
1133  result = getenv(var+4);
1134  }
1135  }
1136 
1137  if (result != NULL && resdup)
1138  result = apr_pstrdup(p, result);
1139  if (result == NULL)
1140  result = "";
1141  return (char *)result;
1142 }
